Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Condado”
Reviews.Author: SolDeMar8
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business and I love it. It's right in the middle of Condado (close to the best restaurants in the area) and five minutes away from Old San Juan. The complimentary breakfast is good and the rooms are comfortable enough. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a comfortable place to crash in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Kirlpamp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of about 15-20 people on a recent school trip. I was a bit nervous after reading the reviews, but it's actually a pretty nice place. It's a bit cramped and the rooms are much smaller than what you'd find back in the U.S. The breakfast isn't bad, it's a pretty typical American breakfast. We weren't at the hotel much anyways, but it was still nice when we were here. I'd recommend it to anyone who's looking for a cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Doooooonnnnn't waste ur time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cubanprince
Reviews.Content: Don't waste you money. This by far was one of the worst hotels I've stayed in. Where to start first the room was so small that every time u showered the half the room would fog up. After it would get so muggy. 2nd the elevator was the size of a small closet and super slow. Mind u it just went up and down 7 floor and the elevator took mins to get to the floor you were at.when I went to pay they authorized the wrong amount by $1500. 7 days later I finally got my money.so many things wrong with this hotel to mention. The only good part of the hotel was the staff very friendly ad helpful. The maids were very friendly and they cleaned the room well. Besides that the hotel was a no go for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haughk
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 8 nights while we toured around puerto rico the staff was very nice and helpful the room was clean and comfortable but a little small. we had a small fridge in our room that i asked for when we arrived. the location is excellent. the parking garage across the street is cheap and safe. parking on the street is iffy they write a lot of tickets. we liked the hotel. we cruised the competition while we were there and we were quite happy with our choice. typical holiday inn breakfast (i usually grab some fruit). over all i would recommend this place it was perfect for us. if you want to spend a lot of time at the beach or in your room stay across the street at la concha but get ready to pay if you want a good home base for adventuring this place works.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel1000
Reviews.Content: Just about 1 block from the beach, so very convenient. However the only hotel in this area with absolutely no view of any kind. Decent rooms, a bit old but clean and fairly comfortable ( no microwave fridge etc). Breakfast is just okay. ( I mean given the location and availability of very good breakfast joints all around, a regular HInn breakfast is just okay. At least fresh fruit could have been better). No parking, so if you have a car , you willed up paying $18 per day ( with in & out privileges) but without a car, nearby taxis, walkable to nearby restaurants, beach and hotels. (free street parking is usually difficult to get) Very safe neighborhood even at 2 am , 3 am ish I had a low floor room, with street noises and loud air conditioner, but expect that higher floors maybe okay. Wasn't given any special rooms despite Platinum status and advance notice. Night staff very helpful. Daytime staff were indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Nice Breakfast, Clean Rooms,Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: dasmit6
Reviews.Content: 3/8-3/12 wonderful stay within walking distance to 2 beaches. It's 1 block off of the main strip so you can retreat to a quiet place. Bathroom is small but the shower water is hot and soft. Beds are comfortable with both firm and soft pillows on bed. Staff very helpful. Full hot breakfast provided. Taxis outside front door 24/7 and a tour desk in lobby to schedule excursions. It's an older buidling so elevator is small, but it works fine. Great value and no shocking resort fee added on top of taxes. I guess with any hotel there are mixed experiences. My other friends were in a room with a tv that was not as clear as mine and one said she didn't like the smell. Everyday, I saw workers performing general cleaning and mopping floors. I brought incense since I had read previous posts, but didn't feel I needed it once I got my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: nessy65
Reviews.Content: We stayed before and after a cruise. Before our cruise our room (on the fifth floor) was very clean, some smell from the humidity, but the air conditioning took care of that. The staff help so much, ie, which bus to take, good local food places, and where not to waste your money. The breakfast was good for the price of the hotel. After our cruise we got a suite (priority club member), very clean room, just don't know what to do with four phones in the room. The room was great! Overall, great location, beach is a half block away, no parking, bus stops are a couple of blocks away, great food minutes away, price was resonable, but the rooms were CLEAN.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs down - Go in Knowing”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunch
Reviews.Content: We were passing through San Juan, so needed an inexpensive hotel to crash for the night - but even with low expectations not sure we would go back! The rooms are dingy, our toilet did not function properly, walls need scrubbing. One of our friends found an earring in her sheets as she turned down her bed to go to sleep - never a good sign! Pros, hotel is close to cruise terminal, it's inexpensive, front desk staff very nice, location good - across the street from a nice restaurant, beach and and 4 star hotel LaConcha. Just go in knowing that this hotel works as a pit stop, nothing more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: OceanCloud
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights beforevour cruise and loved the location in the heart of the Condado neighborhood. The hotel has a nice front lobbybalthough, like the rooms, it is a bit small. Our room had 2 double beds but was very small. The bathroom is tiny but impeccably clean. The continental breakfast featured the traditional Holiday Inn fare. The coffee however was very good. The pool area is not very big, a theme here, but still a nice place to spend some time. The hot tub was lobster- pot hot though! This hotel is a stone's throw from Condado beach. Also, all kinds of options for dining, shopping and casinos. Try Orozco's for some fantastic portorican mofongo!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: RaeleneSchats
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was great! The rooms are clean & comfortable and the air conditioning was a bonus! Only a half a block from the beach and a great shopping strip. The breakfast in the mornings was great with sausage, pancakes, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice, and those yummy egg omelets...what a treat to not have to go to far to have a yummy breakfast!!!! The staff at the front desk was very friendly and polite, making it even nicer! I would definately recommend staying here!!! Just a tip....a taxi is $23 to Old San Juan from here or you can walk just down the street and get on the bus for .75 cents ......major money saver :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: southerngalNc
Reviews.Content: There are much nicer Inns at the same price level in the area. Closer to the beach. This place is a racket and tourist trap. They do their best to take advantage of non-locals. The rooms are dirty and there is no parking. They will lead you to park in an area where you WILL get a parking ticket--especially if it is apparent that you are in a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chris3081
Reviews.Content: Liked the location of this hotel.....stayed two nights. Decent continental breakfast, friendly and courteous staff. No parking. Pool cold. Did run out of several items for breakfast on Saturday. (Including coffee--twice!) Big, well appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Solar-sailor
Reviews.Content: I few in from the Dominican Republic and was very happy to leave...and even more happy to arrive at the Holiday Inn in San Juan. The hotel is not on the water, but a short walk and I was in the sand. The open and airy hotel doesn't look like most Holiday Inns - this is Caribbean treat. My best memory was the bar/restaurant. I sat outside land enjoyed the January evening, listening the unique frogs and ordering individual portions until I was stuffed. The asian restaurant was not as much fun - good food, but a different atmosphere. The pool as nice and the view from my room was great. The hotel is close to the airport, but no so close that you hear the planes. I didn't have a car for two days, but that was not a problem. San Juan has a good bus service and a trip the old fort took about 30 minutes. When I did rent a car I got a ticket - it seems that "Parking for Touristas" does not mean that tourists can park there - a "Tourista" is a sightseeing bus. This was my first visit to Puerto Rico, but it will not be my last. In all honesty I was a bit concerned - you hear about Puerto Rican gangs in New York, but my fears were unfounded. I found the people warm and friendly. One hotel employee told me, "Everyone speaks some English, so if you try to speak Spanish and they try to speak English you won't have a problem." Language was never an issue. The roads are like US highways, you buy gas in liters, the speed limit is posted in miles per hour, but distances are posted in kilometers - takes about 20 minutes to get used to it. US currency, my cell phone worked well and I'm ready to go back. If you visit the rum factory I suggest you take the bus, they offer generous samples.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown but close to ocean”
Reviews.Author: nurse4death
Reviews.Content: We had to book this at the last minute and had excellent service. The pool was behind the hotel and was very private and quaint. The breakfast was excellent the next morning and the rooms were spacious and clean. It was a close walk to the ocean and we could see it from the hotel although it did not face the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “only the location worth”
Reviews.Author: photopek
Reviews.Content: Noisy,filthy lobby and bad.The house cleaners make terrible noisy even at 3 pm.The staff are not polite even that i am platinum member.Only the location of the hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: arobiks
Reviews.Content: When we first walked in the room we found the fragrance was too strong (I guess from housekeeping). Almost toxic. Shortly after, I went in the washroom and noticed a large insect under the sink-we didn't know if it was a beetle or cockroach. Maintenance didn't even know what it was. Very disgusting. We wanted to get a refund and leave, but unfortunately I got this through the internet and it was already too late. We also had our toilet almost flood twice with little toilet paper used both times, so obviously there was something wrong with the toilet itself. We didn't even get an apology for what we went through. The place also needs to be updated. I wouldn't even recommend this hotel for one night. Go to Sheraton or Marriott instead and pay a bit more-it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-ss-64
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre- and post cruise this January and February and loved it. We admired the staffÂ´s patience towards the crowd arriving and leaving for cruises all at the same time. We agree with what people have been writing about the hotel since we stayed there and do not have anything to add, they all seem pleased. We hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good for pre-cruise, post-cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Beachie77
Reviews.Content: We thought we had forgot our phone chargers and my husband went down to the front desk to ask where an AT'T store was. An older gentleman at the front desk gave him charger to take with us on the cruise and said to bring back after the cruise. How nice was that!!! The room was clean. No carpet, but I think there would be less germs this way. Good location. Across the street from the beach. Catch a bus about a block away for 75 cents to Old San Juan. Surprised that the breakfast had omelets. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good, simple hotel in the Condado district”
Reviews.Author: GregRuth
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in the Condado district of San Juan was just what I was looking for. Typical of HI Express properties in urban settings: compact, reasonably priced, well-run. The room was small but clean and modern, with the usual amenities for this chain: free breakfast, cable flat screen TV, free wifi, coffee maker, etc. The hotel has a tiny pool and a hot tub. What I liked most, though, was its proximity to the beach and a little park (only one block away). It's in the nice Condado district, which has lots of restaurants, shops, etc. A 75 cent bus ride from San Juan's Old Town and close (a mile or two) to the Pan American Pier where the cruise ships are. Not a 5-star, but perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: lynnj73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise. The price was right and the breakfast was a bonus. The breakfast was typical fare...danish, muffin, egg sandwiches etc. The pool are was nice. The rooms were small and a bit dated. Short walk to the beach and area restaurants. Would stay again pre or post cruise. I would not want to stay for a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “"A place to settle the night before the cruise with an added perk."”
Reviews.Author: bluelineMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at this property on 1-20-12 prior to a cruise. We didn't arrive until after midnight. The front desk person was cordial and gave us direction's to our room. I am fairly certain the room was an old storage area. The stateroom on our cruise was about the same size. As others have stated the room was humid and musty. I found the room to be extremely clean. After running the air overnight the room was no longer humid but still musty. The continental breakfast hit the spot. There was plenty of food. It was typical of what Holiday Inn Express generally serves. From the breakfast area you could see the pool. It appeared nice and well maintained. The major pro's of this hotel was the cost compared to others in the area. The best part check out isn't until 12pm. Which is great if you are waiting to board a cruise ship because this hotel is less then a block from the beach. After breakfast take a quick stroll to the beach come back, check out, and off to the cruise you go. Don't be alarmed by the three stars. This room worked for us as it was nothing more than a 12 hour stop before our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night”
Reviews.Author: Travel2plus1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Holiday Inn Express in San Juan on New Years Eve - pre cruise. The hotel was just as we had read on other reviews. The room was small and the bathroom was very tiny. I would not stay there for an extended period of time but the room was clean and the staff were very helpful and courteous. The breakfast buffet was busy but the food was good and again the woman who staffed the area made sure that we found a table and that everything was suitable. Pre cruise - taxi ride was pleasant, check in was fast and without incident and there was a taxi available to take us to the cruise port when we were ready. All in all, for the price it was worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, the front desk clerk was more interested in making phone calls and talking on her cell phone then assisting us. The bedroom we were given was very small and cramped, not at all like the deluxe accommodations that we booked after viewing the pictures of the accommodations on their web site. ON checking out, again the front desk clerk seemed to be having a private conversation on her cell phone, and didn't even say a word to us as she handed us the bill to review and sign. I won't be staying here again. For the price, much better accommodations can be found in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Floor”
Reviews.Author: Tommyk96
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Holiday Inn Express over Christmas. Our room had a gorgeous view of the ocean which really made our stay special. The lobby has a pleasant airy feel and the hotel itself offers easy access to everything in the Condado. Also, Old San Juan is a $15 cab ride away. The only shortfalls were low water pressure and an underwhelming breakfast. The Condado is very touristy and built-up, so most of your morning food choices will involve chain operations and hotels. However, Starbucks is located both in the Conrad Plaza Hotel or across from the Marriot Stellaris (in opposite directions on Ashford Avenue) and has the usual great coffee and breakfast pastry. The La Concha hotel across the street has a very nice full buffet with excellent coffee, hot foods, cheese, eggs, etc, but be prepared to shell out $25 per person. Speaking of La Concha, you can also go to the beach in front of the hotel and rent a chair for $5 per day and sit there like you're one of the Jet Set. You can even take advantage of the cocktail service on the beach as long as you have time to wait and are willing to spend a little money. But if you're on your hard earned vacation, there is no nicer way to spend the morning than drinking Pina Coladas on that beautiful beach. Otherwise, we loved our time at the Holiday Inn. Friendly staff, nice bed, a tile floor in a very clean room, strong air-conditioner and close proximity to attractions. We really had a $400 per night experience for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express- great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: canuckx3NewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night pre cruise. The hotel is a budget hotel so people should not expect this to be a resort, and the price is budget friendly to match. The room was clean, a little on the small side with a musty smell (but Puerto Rico has high humidity so this can happen) the location is great; itâ€™s in the Coronado area so you can go out and walk around at night and not worry. We only arrived late in the evening & had to go out to find food and that was a concern of ours - but the police presence is high as this is a popular tourist area. The continental breakfast was nice the next morning with a good assortment of food. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the night before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: burbot
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from the airport and the taxi ride was $15 plus $1 per bag. The streets are very narrow and I was concerned the cab would brush up against parked cars but he did a good job. Check in was easy and the clerk was nice. The room was small, and smelled a bit damp but it was fine and clean. In fact, I would have given it 4 stars except that I tried to take a shower this morning and it was warm but not hot. The continental breakfast was fine. I had a banana and tea and brought a selection of muffins and pastries back to the room for the kids. The hotel is well located and I took a walk to the beach this morning and a Starbucks a few blocks away. Oh, the internet connection was good and free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel located near some good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: mayaruinsonly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night but have no complaints at all. The rooms were very nice and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible booking experience”
Reviews.Author: LisaS31
Reviews.Content: First I'd like to say something nice...front desk clerk at check-in was very apologetic, professional and courteous, which is all the nice I can come up with for our experience at this hotel. Musty smell was pretty bad, thank goodness I use cpap which filters my air. The unforgiveable part is that I had booked SIX MONTHS in advance and corporate did not pass the booking information to the facility properly. I had confirmation email showing all confirmed....king bed non-smoking.... That is NOT what we found upon check-in. I showed the front desk clerk my reservation confirmation and she was very apologetic but explained that there were no king beds available and the corporate booking info they had received did not show KING BED NON-SMOKING but rather house standard. After a very long flight and a late night arrival, I promise it was not welcome news. I sent corporate an email after our return and no response. The property is "tired", musty and had mattresses that should have been retired long before our visit. Barely makes it to a 2-star facility. I travel a lot with business and my expectations may be a bit above this properties capability but the corporate screw up is unforgiveable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stokil1
Reviews.Content: There seems to be a mixed bag of reviews of this hotel. When this is the case, we usually take a chance as hotels are usually never as bad as the reviews make them out to be. However, after spending one night "pre-cruise" we cancelled the "post-cruise" night we had booked. I would classify this hotel as "tired". The biggest issues for us was the room was damp and "moldy-smelling", and the bedsheets felt "wet" when we crawled in (we arrived at 11:30PM so we didn't bother to complain or change the room). We also wondered whether the bedsheets had been changed from previous guests, but did not discover this until the morning. On the "nuetral" side, the room was smaller than average, the floor was tile instead of carpet, the bathroom was barely large enough to turn around in, and the elevator was so small the 4 of us had to take separate trips (when we had our luggage). The breakfast area was far too small for the number of rooms in the hotel. Staff was polite and accomodating. All in all, it was one night and we survived, but we wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay post cruise”
Reviews.Author: roamingirishman
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights post cruise and found it to be a very nice hotel.the room was very nice and spotless.breakfast was ample with a nice choice.staff were very helpful when trying to print boarding passes for flight.the hotel is situated in a nice safe lively area with plenty of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “stay away...not good at all”
Reviews.Author: Ann-Marie G
Reviews.Content: I just had 4 couples stay at this hotel on November 19th. They were all very very unhappy. The hotel had mold and there were fans in the hallway because the air conditioning didn't work. Upon check out 1 set of clients had an issue and they were treated very rudely. I will never put clients in this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: snuffysteve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I cruise quite often and whenever we cruise out of San Juan we stay a night here. The rooms are small and the bathrooms are also pretty small, but the hotel is in a decent neighborhood and has always been spotless clean. it is about a one block walk from the beach. We have always felt safe walking around this area...day or night and have never had any problems. There are several good restaurants and a mini mart.(we always have to buy beer and wine for our room) within a few blocks from the hotel. The pool and hot tub are also pretty small but have always been properly maintained and very clean. The hotel has always held our luggage for us after checkout in a locked room just behind the front counter until we can board our ship. Taxi cabs are always waiting near the front door in the morning and early afternoon to take people to the airport or cruise ships.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay in a fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: adidas0203
Reviews.Content: I received this room as a Holiday Inn Priority Club Member. The hotel staff were very friendly, the continental breakfast had good food and the room was an ok size (we had a 2 double bed room). We were on the top floor so it was very quiet up there and the only downside to the hotel is that the elevators are very tiny. The hotel is in a great area, just across the street from the beach. If you're not looking for a fancy hotel and just need a quick stay, this would be the ideal place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Should have believed the negative reviews --- boo to Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: Am a Holiday Inn Priority Club Member, & had reservations for 3 nights, but only stayed the 1. Have stayed at many Holiday Inn Express properties all over the US, but rate this hotel the worst. This hotel will definitely not help Holiday Inn improve their brand image. All the comments about small rooms & tiny (1 person) bathrooms are true, but that is not the basis of our complaint. However, the comments about the employee who is "supposedly" in charge of the breakfast service, confirms our experience. We have visited San Juan dozens of times for 20+ years, & stayed all over the area around this hotel, so we know the area & like it. We also remember this hotel during prior years when it had various names, but then it sat abandoned for several years before being remodeled & renamed Holiday Inn Express. So we gave it a try, but it was definitely a mistake. The uphostelry on the room/desk chair was so filthy that we covered it with a towel before we would sit in it. All the lamp shades looked like they had come from a flea market, torn/worn/tattered, & light bulbs were missing in 2 of the 3. Don't know when this hotel renovation was actually completed, but it could already use a serious update. Don't know how sheets, that are supposedly changed after each guest, can be this wrinkled & look like the ones on our bed, but it raised serous red flags about cleanliness. And the phone never did work. Apparently they had it blocked to prevent calls from being made, & neither the night or day front desk employees knew how to unblock the line. The tiny bathroom was OK-clean, but the fixtures look like the place has not been remodeled for years. And breakfast, which is a selling feature of the Holiday Inn Express brand, was non-existent upon our arrival about 8:15AM. The ENTIRE food offering consisted of 3-4 stale-looking danish, a loaf of bread that had been torn open for access, 3-4 boiled eggs in the refrigerator unit, & some cereal that we had no intention of touching after looking around the room. That was it. Nothing else. There was no milk, or hot water for tea. No regular coffee, only de-caf. There was not a single, solitary item of "any" kind in the unit where hot food is supposed to be placed, & the refrigerator unit had nothing in it except the 3-4 boiled eggs. Zero. In fact, these 2 pieces of food equipment seemed to be brand new, like they had never been used. There a few people sitting in the breakfast area & they stated that they were only having the de-caf coffee & had not seen ANY employee in the breakfast area since their arrival. One couple said it had been that same way the 2 prior mornings of their stay. Did the same employee another reviewer complained about, simply fail to show up for work for 3 days? Or is this standard operating procedure? We moved to another property in the immediate area, but since we were only a 10 minute walk away, we returned 2 more mornings between 8-9AM just to see if our experience was an accident, but it wasn't. The same exact breakfast room scenario was present. Non-existent food. Coffee pots empty. Looked like an abandoned, unkempt lunch room. This is a problem property for Holiday Inn, that I predict will not remain in the chain much longer. Several other pleasant properties in the immediate area, so try them. No need to spend extra to "mistakenly think" you're going to get something better at this hotel. On the plus side, both ladies at check-in & check-out were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “$150 for $60 value.”
Reviews.Author: YoAlizeRaps
Reviews.Content: If you can stay at a place like this, save your money and stay at a motel. They reserved us a queen deluxe, and I'm up here looking at a double bed and no deluxe nothing, unless that means two phones and a box tv. U can't even get the luggage cart in the room. There is absolutely nowhere to park either. The desk clerk told us to pay for parking down the street somewhere. For $150, you can stay at a so-so golf resort. This place feels moldy and smells funny. I booked online and they're telling us if we don't stay, we still have to pay for the three nights we reserved. Bullcrap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: olendor
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are staying for a cruise. Clean, near all of the high end shops like Cartier, Gucci. Great restaurants and cafe. Hotel is very clean and staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan wedding destination”
Reviews.Author: nunillo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the days before my wedding. The lady in the front desk received me with a big smile. She was real nice. The location in condado is great. Right in front of the "Ventana" a small park with an awesome view of condado beach. Is walking distance from expensive hotel where you can go and enjoy the nightlife (lobby bars and clubs). The rooms are a little bit to small, it will be tight for a family but for friends or couples I will totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what expected of holiday inn express!”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: Good luck trying to find this hotel, hidden in an alley. Parking was not acceptable- when you have to park your vehicle, then lock it behind a chain link and pad lock, it is not a good sign! I frequently stay at Holiday Inn Express all through out the US, but this hotel definitely did not have the same standards. The lady at the front desk was very nice, but we almost didn't make it onto the tiny elevator with all of our luggage- holds maybe 6 people max. The room appeared old and was extremely tiny! The bedding was clean, but the walls were dirty and the tiled floors were not comfortable, but cold and unwelcoming. The bathroom was ridiculously small. We stayed one night and moved on to another Holiday Inn in Ponce, which exceeded our expectations. I will not recommend the holiday inn express to anyone wanting to visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump, stay away...”
Reviews.Author: Rocket455
Reviews.Content: Checked into this near impossible to find dump, made the front desk aware I was a IHG Platnum member ( they didn't have my number on the res ) and was told no upgrades availble, but I had one of the best rooms in the hotel. WOW !!! If this was one of the best I would hate to see the bad ones. The bathroom was tiny, the ceiling was all patched up with peeling paint, the light fixture in this supposed upscale room was an industrial bare tube flourecesent, the fixtures all rusty, the mirror over the vanity falling apart and the finish peeling off, the grout all going green. The room was no better, falling apart closet doors from Home depot, amature installation looking crappy tile floors with grosse grout, creepy not so clean walls... all this with a bid sony flat screen tv, this money could have gone to better use... one of those places you deliberate whether to sleep on top of the bed with you clothes on. Just stay away, I can't imagine how this place gets to be a Holiday Inn Express in the first place. I don't feel samarter for having stayed here, just creeped out and ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: redpoker
Reviews.Content: I will say that the front desk staff was extremely friendly. but i had a few mishaps at the hotel. first the room is quite small and so is the bathroom. you have to pay for a parking that is very small and does not have enough space. Make sure you keep your items in the safe because they will dissapear. Once speaking to one of the managers she was very rude and uncaring. would not go again. And their breakfast was always minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre or post-cruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: canuck43
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Holiday Inn a few times before a cruise out of San Juan. This is a reasonably priced hotel and keep that in mind. Elevators are small, the rooms are tight but for one night, and at a very competitive price, definitely check it out. The breakfast is a nice way to start your day and included in your rate. It is a short walk to a nearby casino, many eating establishments and the ocean is 2 minutes away. Bus route is close by so this is a great location for many reasons. Definitely consider staying here. The a/c in the room is loud but it can be adjusted to suit your temperature preference. Beds are comfortable but as others have pointed out, the room feels musty due to the high humidity levels in San Juan. Front desk staff is very pleasant and helpful. Taxis are usually out front of the hotel when you are ready to head to your cruise ship...Hope you find this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: QNeeN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last minute. The hotel was very accommodating allowing me to extend my stay last minute for 3 more days. The guest service reps at the desk are very friendly, proficient in english as well as spanish and extremely helpful. We asked for many opinions and directions including but not limited to, restaurants, how to get to certain spots using the bus or other forms of transportation, which tour companies were best to use and they never steered us wrong. The rooms were small, but very clean and the beds were beyond comfortable. Cable gave you many choices (if you really want to watch tv in a place as beautiful as PR). Pool setting is quaint and comfortable. Hotel is close to the beach and has a nice park to go sit and watch people, or move to the other side and watch the ocean. For the money it is worth it for the service it is more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Romina_Peluffo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, convenient and comfortable hotel, located 2 minutes away from Condado beach, restaurants, the casino and other attractions. Having the breakfast buffet included is great, they had a good selection and changed it up everyday. The staff was helpful every time we needed assistance. The rooms were clean, well maintained and affordable. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, it feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: ClauIlian
Reviews.Content: First of all, my family and I would like to say thank you to EDITH at front desk for gave us the best service we ever had. We had an incredible 4 nights experience at this hotel. It has a nice location in Condado, good breakfast and the rooms are clean and contains all necessary. We felt in love with San Juan, Puerto Rico and we would definitely back to stay at the Holiday Inn Express waiting to see Edith's smiling again and sleep in this home at Condado. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME EDITH! Greetings from Mexico, City.

Reviews.Title: “Sufficient for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: mari962
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two kids and I stayed in this hotel for one night before our Carnival Cruise. It was fine. The rooms were clean and neat. The breakfast room was clean and the selection of foods was sufficient. We did not use the pool or the jacuzzi but they looked nice.The woman at the front desk, Edith, was very helpful and informative about touring Old San Juan- what buses to use and where to go. The hotel was centrally located.- it was a short bus ride to Old San Juan and a short walk to the beach. The beach in Condado, where the hotel is, was GORGEOUS. Also we were a short walk away from lots of restaurants and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy-Rox
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located, walking distance to the beach, restaurants and bus station. Breakfast included was good. The room very confortable and clean. Small bathroom. We stayed on the 5th. floor. Has a small pool, jacuzzi, friendly atmosphere and welcoming personnel. I recommend this hotel for anybody coming on vacations. Parking space small and they charge US$ 10 per night. No need to have a car if you are touring Old San Juan and going to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The employees at this hotel are so friendly they make you feel like family.”
Reviews.Author: Anairil
Reviews.Content: Its was money worth, located near the beach, casinos and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. Luv the free breakfast, helps save a few extra dollars and the service is excellent. They gave us a very warm welcome and David was kind in taking our suit cases to our room. The Front Desk Reps. were very helpful in giving directions and also giving us ideas on tours. I totally recomend this hotel, I look foward in returning next year........

Reviews.Title: “Avoid breakfast!!! otherwise ok for cruise layovers!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDianne
Reviews.Content: need I say more?? We arrived at night after a long haul journey, and were quickly checked into a clean acceptable room. Breakfast in the morning was a shock!! Maybe we Europeans just aren't used to extremely processed hot food, but the fruit, cereal & coffee were fine. Not sure what everyone else was eating though!! Good location across the road from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute trip, literally, and showed up at SJU at 5pm with no reservations on a Saturday afternoon. I called and got a room here. I am PC Plat and was hoping for an upgrade but got a standard room, not even sure if HIX has any upgraded rooms but if they did, I didn't get one. Room was acceptable. Clean but nothing special. Toilet was running and making too much noise so called the front desk and they said they would send someone to look at it. Left as I had to spend a few hours taking care of the business that brought me to Puerto Rico then headed back to the hotel. Toilet still running quite noisily. I was tired and ready to eat. Wanted room service but there was none. Had to head back out. Got back and my key didn't work. Had to go back down to get another. Service was ok but certainly no one was going out of there way to make things right. Seemed this was a good cruise hotel and is probably a fine hotel for this purpose but I think I would probably look elsewhere if I was staying for more than 1 night. I am saying I would recommend as overall the hotel was ok and the price was right, but again, probably would recommend just as a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Traveller Beware”
Reviews.Author: Joanne43323
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for one night before our cruise and selected this hotel because it was close to the beach and thought it might be a nice change. It was reported to be a no frills hotel but clean and good value for the money. The first room on the third floor was disgusting. We noticed a strong smell when we got off the elevator but the smell was worse if that was possible, when we entered the room. It smelled like a wet bathing suit that's been sealed up in a plastic bag in the heat for a week. Our second room on the fifth floor seemed O.K so we went down to the front desk to speak to them about the smell. We were told that the hotel was full and there was nothing they could do for us. I explained that we have asthma and that I didn't think any of us would be able to sleep in there. When they could see I wasn't going to give up they finally agreed to switch that room with another on the fourth floor which was better. We found out that this was because the air conditioning was on full blast and when you turned it off, the smell came back. Not only was it loud in the room due to the air conditioning running all night but the room was extremely cold which made for an unpleasant night for my daughter and her husband. Our room on the fifth floor was fine until we woke up in the morning to find that the floor was covered in water. Since the floor is tiled, this was quite dangerous as I slipped and fell when I got up. The water stretched from the bathroom into the room and right under the bed. Unfortunately, our luggage was sitting in this and was soaked on the bottom. When I called the front desk to tell them, the girl didn't seem shocked or surprised. Neither did the fellow who came up with the shop vac to clean it up. I have never experienced such awful conditions in a Holiday Inn or anywhere for that matter. This was not our first stay in San Juan and probably not our last but I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Go some place else”
Reviews.Author: ncflightmedic
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I'm a Priority Club Gold Member. The first stay was Mar 24-26. I booked a king deluxe got a twin (no other rooms available, they were all booked). I made the reservations in November. No internet functioning in the rooms. I asked for a late check out for my cruise and was told they couldn't accomidate me. The mattress had not been rotated, so one side was higher than the other. Like sleeping on the side of a hill. Second stay was after my cruise in April 2-4. I got my king deluxe, but the internet in the room was sporadic at best. The sofa looked like it belonged in a frat house (stains, paint droppings), the floor look was dirty (my white socks turned brown/black on the bottom), there was dirt and hair on the floor, and to gross everyone out there was a stain on the wall as you walked in that looked like "snot". Day 2 I didn't get replacement towels. The maid took them but didn't replace them. I had to use what was left over. I'm a Holiday Inn fanatic. I will usually drive an hour just to stay in one due to the customer service and high standards. This hotel is far from the Holiday Inn standards. I'm going back to San Juan next year and won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “" Simply Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: gemini52957
Reviews.Content: Breakfast Selection The Works, Staff Outstanding Service And Attentive :) The Room I Had Was Spacious, BUT!! Only 1 Mirror :( In The Bathroom, Not In The Room. Nice Flat Screen T.V. VIZIO & Radio Had MP Player. Camera all Around & Lot's Of Towels Thick & Very Clean. I Walked Barefoot & Checked My Feet, I SWEAR, NO Lie!! My Feet Were Clean, I Was Like, What!! That Never Happens :) Tranquil Atmosphere AHHH! I'm Coming back In May, 2011 Birthday In This Hotel Was Treated Like A Celebrity I'm Highly Recommending To All In NYC, To Stay @ The Holiday Inn Express San Juan. Thanks To All & The Que Pasa Magazine, WHY? it Was Advertised On The 2nd Page & I'm So Glad I Stayed With Them :) Gracias!! 1 More Month & I'm BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Makanawaves
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 day layover in San Juan and moved here after our original hotel turned out to be dismal. Very lovely room, nice pool, full breakfast, good service and wonderful location across from nice park with fountain opening to beachfront. Near upscale shopping if you're into that sort of thing, and short taxi or even bus ride from Old San Juan. Affordable and great for after cruise or San Juan touring of old city, fort, etc. Wouldn't necessarily stay at HI Express on vacation in US, but this one was beautifully decorated and perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For What it is”
Reviews.Author: TheLadyJ
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a room for one night after we got off our cruise. This place is perfect for just that. It's not as fancy (or as expensive) as the nearby resorts in Candado, but it's only 1 block from the beach and expensive shopping. Sunday mornings there are extremely busy, but the woman at the counter, Edith, was polite and helpful. She explained that our rooms were not ready (it was noon and check-in is at 4pm), but the hotel would hold our bags for us if we wanted to go out. The room was clean, and the hotel has a nice little enclosed area with a pool and hot tub. The breakfast in the morning, while there were no seats available, was perfectly fine with a nice selection. The only complaint was that we reserved a King room and they gave us a room with two double beds. We didn't bother to report it, but I'm sure they would have accomodated us, but it would have meant an even longer wait and we were tired.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: IslandBoundinKS
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the airport around 5:00. We were checked in quickly and we were nicely surprised to find out we had been upgraded to a suite. When we booked the hotel originally the only non-smoking room available was one king bed so we were going to have to squeeze a rollaway bed into the room for my son to sleep on. The suite was basically two combined rooms so my son ended up with his own room with a bathroom and tv. The front desk gave us some suggestions for where we could walk to dinner. We felt safe walking around the area at night and ended up at Cafe Angel. Very good Puerto Rican food but SLOW service. In the morning we grabbed breakfast from the hotel and walked over to the beach to look around before we had to check out at 12:00. After some sightseeing we headed to the hotel and plenty of cabs were available to take us to the port - about a 20 minute drive. Overall we thought it was a great choice for a nice, clean and inexpensive hotel for our one night in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: vinnie77
Reviews.Content: good hotel great service,good breakfast included. very clean hotel.15 minutes from old san juan. we went with city bus cost 75 cents per person! nice location in condado.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: luvcruisin1007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a precruise 1 night stay. We had 2 rooms -they were clean, the beds were comfortable the pool area/hot tube was clean. The breakfast was also good. Its in a nice location-you have a beach, fast food, casino and a Walgreens all in walking distance. We had 6 people, we took a taxi from the airport to the hotel-taxi service was $15 total+ $1 per bag and in the morning the taxis are lined up on the street outside the hotel to take you to the port. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but questionable rooms”
Reviews.Author: scotiajim
Reviews.Content: Great location in Condado right across from the beach and strip. Hotel has a tiny lobby, rooms are small and not very well appointed. Worst of all there was a musty smell in the hallways and rooms. Not very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: KristiKaye
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisor reviews booked one night precruise. The main disappointment was location in regards to the cruise ports. The reason I booked here was because it was touted as a convenient pre/post cruise. It is a 20.00 cab ride to port. There are 2 ports for the cruise ships and we had no idea which one we were departing from, but regardless this was not a good location. The best location is the Sheraton in Old San Juan ( if you are leaving from this port-it was already booked when I booked in July for Jan!) The H.I.E. is definitely not in Old San Juan. We walked there the night before cruising and it was a full hour walk at a fast pace. (not very safe either). We also felt the rate was too high for what we got. Basically 200. with taxes. Obviously they know when the cruises are! The room was TINY. Very loud a/c. The bathroom was TINY but had been remodeled. OK free breakfast. The room furnishings were dated. Fairly comfortable bed. Would not recommend to othersor plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping left our door locked OPEN”
Reviews.Author: hphinc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is unimpressive in many respects. Some are forgivable, some are not. For starters, they gave us the wrong room (a double instead of a king). When we called the front desk to notify them of the mistake, they claimed that we booked it that way. My wife pulled out the printed receipt of the reservation that said "King" and we took it down to them, and only then did they begrudgingly fix it. The room was a little small, but oh well. The next day, we went to old San Juan for the day. When we arrived back at our room, housekeeping had left the door LOCKED OPEN. Anyone could enter just by pulling the door open. My wife immediately phoned the front desk to discuss the issue. Their response was "come back in the morning, and we'll leave a note for the manager." Not even an apology. My wife told them that was unacceptable and made it very known how upset we were about the situation. (All our valuables including laptops could have been stolen by anyone at will). Such an egregious over-sight demanded more contrition than what, in effect, was I can put your complain on a post-it, and stick it on the manager's desk in the morning. We immediately packed up, and checked in across the street at La Concha. The price difference was negligible. The rooms are FAR superior, the staff actually pays attention to you. Save yourself the hassle, and just go there to begin with. The entire time, even after the front desk girl finally called the manager on duty to deal with the issue, NO ATTEMPT was made to save the sale, console us, or otherwise attempt to perform any type of customer service. In fairness, after I left the hotel, and the front desk girl watched us haul 5 bags out in two different trips to the hotel across the street, and then when we went to check out to give them the room keys back, she did finally apologize... albeit, it sounded more like a formality than a heartfelt apology.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: babz1019
Reviews.Content: When you hear that you will be staying at a Holiday Inn Express, you imagine a small hotel with no character - this hotel was the complete opposite! 2 blocks from the beach on a side street, this hotel was the BEST! Not only was it convenient to tourist attractions but it is far away enough to get away from crazed tourists. Very relaxing atmosphere with AMAZING staff. Traveling with about 10 members of my family, everything was very smooth. I even left something behind and it was sent to me within a week. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a hotel that is close to all the attractions yet far away enough to enjoy a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed-- clean, convenient and close to the action”
Reviews.Author: maramima
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at a very busy time of year-- during the Festival de la Calle San Sebastian in Old San Juan. The staff was very courteous, friendly, and accommodating. Check in and Check out were super fast and easy. My room was pretty basic-- A/C worked great, the shower was nice and hot (almost too hot at times), and was clean. I loved the Jacuzzi/Pool area-- its really nice and definitely had a relaxing, lounge feel. The free wi-fi and breakfast were nice touches too. The location is great as there are many restaurants close by-- Orale Guey has cheap drinks, good food and is open late (5am), Tayzan has good Sushi and Casa de Angel had pretty decent Puerto Rican food. Budatai is a more upscale restaurant, but is worth checking out if you're into "celebrity chefs." Walgreens, Starbucks, and various other restaurants and shops (I personally love Hecho a Mano) are within a few blocks. You can even do some high end shopping at Suola, Louis Vuitton, Cartier, etc You can walk up the block and across the street to use the beach behind La Concha, but we walked a few more block to the Marriott to rent chairs from local vendors ($3 for the day) and have more space. If you sit near the Marriott, you also have the option to order drinks/food from waiters, you just have to pay with a credit card. We paid $4 per person for shared cab rides into Old San Juan and Isla Verde when we wanted to leave the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: marypa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night pre cruise, got a good rate and were very happy with the room, service and location. Close to lots of restaurants and to the cruise terminals (15$ taxi ride). Other reviewers must have been unlucky as our stay was fine - but a VERY busy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job!”
Reviews.Author: Dan445
Reviews.Content: Checked into this hotel (as i was staying at the san juan beach and was unhappy there) The holiday inn express is very clean and tidy a little small but for the price can't complain, I don't think u can go far wrong with the big chain hotels such as this one, is 100% better than the previous hotel I was supposed to still be in now, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a budget stay in the carribean

Reviews.Title: “great time in pr”
Reviews.Author: missmetroAtlanta_ga
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre cruise. We almost had two full days in San Juan due to early flight and late ship departure. A short cab ride from the airport. The hotel is on a side street in between Cartier and Gucci in Conado. The hotel is across from a lovely park and beach. You can rent beach chairs for $5.00. Bring a towel from the hotel. Many places to have a nice meal or quick lunch. the staff at the hotel could not have been nicer. The room was small, clean and mold free. At night we went in to old town to see the Christmas lights and walk around with all the families. We ate a great meal at the Blue Parrot. The next morning we caught the bus on the main street from the hotel and went back into Old San Juan and walked, shopped and ate. We got a late checkout from the hotel and then caught a cab to the cruise. $20.00. We thought the hotel was in a perfect location, breakfast ok, transportation easy. You must go have a drink and sit in the bar at La Concha and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FENTON64
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there for 1 night prior to our cruise and we were very glad that we were not staying longer. It looked like most everyone staying at this hotel was going on a cruise. The hotel was clean, but the room was very small and in need of an update. They had a notice in the room that they do not have survey cards available and I am sure that is because they get so many complaints. We did not use the hotel pool, but it was very small. The breakfast buffet was the worst that I have ever had at a Holiday Inn. They had less than the standard selection and were out of most everything. The only hot item was pancakes and there were only a couple of them available. It didn't look like any staff was over seeing the buffet. The hotel also charged $5 for extra for utilities when we checked out .... since when are utilities not part of the standard room charge? We complained to Holiday Inn Corporate after returning from our trip, but received no response. I will not be staying at this hotel again even if it was only for 1 night. I would definitely not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “DAMP BED WITH BITING BED BUGS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: HAZELGRE
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for thankfully only 1 night, the room reeked of dampness, we complained about it and a guy came and sprayed some clear substance on the walls ??, we went out for dinner and upon our return the smell was as bad as ever, so tired so just went to bed only to wake up 1.5 hours later, the bed was soaking with damp and both of us had been badly biten with bed bugs, we put towels on the bed to protect ourselves and managed some sleep, reported the problem in the morning just to be met with a shrug of shoulders, the air-conditioning unit in the room was covered in dust all in all please DO NOT STAY at this hotel it ruined the rest of our holiday due to the bites Walgreens sell a good anti-itch cream thankfully

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few bumps.”
Reviews.Author: PassTravelF00l
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful upon our arrival and seemed genuinely happy to have us there. The lobby of the hotel is newly redone and it is nice. The building is older so there are some limitations to the hotel. The rooms are smallish and the bathrooms are as well but the location more than made up for it. Plus, who goes to Puerto Rico to sit in a hotel room? Parking is limited but no more so than hotels in large cities anywhere although there seems to be a blatant disregard by the locals about not blocking your car in. We had to have the desk get involved both days we tried to leave to get the cars behind us moved. The first day they were very helpful, the second not so much (guess that depends on the luck of the draw with the front desk employee) The location is really unbeatable. Right in the middle of Condado and just a block from water and close to the casinos in the beachfront resorts. The room had a bit of a mildew/mold smell to it but nothing intolerable. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I'll be open to using this hotel when I return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “MOLD MILDEW ODOR - TERRIBLE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lulubirdy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group after a cruise. As soon as I got off the 3rd floor elevator, the mildew odor was evident. However, we proceeded to our room. It was unnoticeable at first since the ac was set on 61. However, after turning it off, the mildew odor was again overwhelming. Eventually, we got used to it and fell asleep. However, after going downstairs for breakfast in the morning and returning to our room, we could not even enter the room as the odor hit us as soon as we opened our door. We both had extreme headaches. The 3rd floor undoubtedly has a mold problem. Go elsewhere if you are concerned about your health.

Reviews.Title: “"Hated it"”
Reviews.Author: VanInTexas
Reviews.Content: Lobby is nice...and that's the only good thing I can say about it. Internet: non-existent. Parking: ridiculous (only about 12 spaces)....you have to leave your keys with the (LONE) front desk agent so they can jockey cars when someone wants in or out. You have to come inside and get a remote to open the gate before you can even get in the lot....every time. If you don't mind standing in the toilet to use the sink, or using the toilet with a doorknob in your face, you might be ok here. Rooms are not carpeted, yet still smell moldy. If you want ice, there's one machine....INSIDE the housekeeping/laundry/employee break room. No printer in biz center and the computers are plagued with viruses. Strange (as in, not mine) hairs in the bed. "Breakfast?" Skip it. Elevator capacity: 2. The staff is very nice. I feel sorry for the people that work there.

Reviews.Title: “Great CLEAN hotel”
Reviews.Author: MakeupBoricua
Reviews.Content: I live in Puerto Rico and have stayed in horrible places. After reading the reviews for this hotel I decided to take a chance. I suffer from alergies and I have had horrible experiences (like the HJ,ughhh) where I had to leave because my alergies got so bad because of the dirty carpets, dust and smells in rooms. This hotel was great; no carpet,no smell in the room and no stinky bed cover. The room was clean so where the towels(very white) and bathrroom. The toiletries smell like apple cinnamon. The pool and jacuzzi,small but nice and best of all they close it at 11pm. The breakfast is included and it had a good variety and its until 9:30am. The only bad things were the wireless in the room is very slow and the fact that there is no parking. You have to park in the street and pay a parking meter or go to a public parking close by. But, I reaaly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: bkabe
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express, San Juan (Condado Section) offers reasonable amenities for the budget traveler who wants to be in the heart of it all without paying the cost. I stayed here twice first in October of 08 then in April of 09. Location: Located on Mariano Ramirez Badges, a side street off of Ashford Ave in the Conrad Section of San Juan. FYI if you are using a GPS system, Mapquest, or the map off the Holiday Inn website you will be shown a different location on those maps. Nonetheless locate the Gucci or Cartier Stores on Ashford Ave and the hotel is on the side street in between them. Mariano Ramirez Badges is a one way street that only stretches about 1 1/2 blocks an is bordered on the south by the Lagoon and on the north by Ashford Ave. Directly across the street on Ashford Ave is a vast grass plaza (open to the public) that belongs to the Renaissance La Concha Hotel. The plaza leads directly to the beach and a pier. Hotel: Seven stories Biege concrete structure that is decorated in a tropical contemporized motif. The hotel offers only 16 parking spaces in a small adjacent lot for $10 a day. Reserve your spot with the booking since it fills up quickly. The hotel offers king and double rooms. A continental breakfast (Bagels, breakfast pasties, cereals, hard boiled eggs, fruits, juice, milk and coffee) is served daily from 6am to 10am. A small pool, business center, and fitness center are also offered. Something not offered is coin laundry. Room: All rooms are tiled and offer a tube television, mini fridge and free Wi-Fi and other additional amenities. The room(s) I stayed at was 601, directly right of the elevator. Although being close to the elevator I never heard any loud noises in my room. The second room was 702 which was mid hallway. The rooms had the same dÃ©cor however 601 was two feet wider then 702 and 601 also contained a mini-fridge and 702 did not. The bathrooms were small however I believe they are standard hotel size. The beds have wheels and tend to move when you move. Air Conditioner unit is in room and you control it yourself. Staff is courteous, friendly and accommodating. Want to go to Old San Juan? Free city bus stop is one block away on Ashford. Hotel tends to get busy on weekends when its fills up with people who are boarding a cruise in the nearby Old San Juan Port. Within Walking Distance Walgreen's 24 Hour Pharmacy, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Renaissance La Concha Casino, Marriott Casino, Chili's, Churches Chicken, Burger King, Krash Puerto Rico, Juniors VIP I and II, Circus Bar Lounge Bottom Line: I really enjoyed this hotel. I found it to be a great deal in a very upscale area. It is walking distance to casinos, Latin cuisine restaurants, fast food chains and the new up and coming gay night life area of Santurce.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, FANTASTIC LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: ingridhulsin
Reviews.Content: One word: LOCATION! Located in one of the most "happening" areas in San Juan, this hotel is all about location. 2 minute walk to the beach, 2 minute walk to La Concha (the "IT" spot for San Juan nightlife -- bar + casino are the best in the city!) and surrounded by upscale shopping (Gucci, LV & Cartier). Tons of things to do in terms of nightlife within a 5 minute walk. Fantastic value for the price as well! For less than $200/night, we got a two room/tow bathroom suite. Free breakfast and wifi!! And parking only costs $10/night -- a steal in San Juan. Don't come here expecting the Ritz Carlton because you will be disappointed. However, for the rate, this place is perfect. The hotel staff is SUPER friendly and helpful, the rooms are great (we had a very spacious suite but I can't speak to the regular rooms) and MOST importantly the location is one of the best! Also have a quaint pool area and fitness center which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetsel70
Reviews.Content: This hotel has truly been a great experience. The staff was exceptional, the cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms were superior. The location was excellent. The only negative was the parking situation. There is no parking around and there is a fee for parking at the hotel. Other than that I really recommend this hotel to anyone that is passing by and wants to see the island. The beach is not close but that is why you rent a car and drive to any beach on the island. A truly wonderful experience we are going back for round 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: mitchyjean
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. not on the beach but close. When in San Juan rent a car. Go see culebra, old san juan, el yunque, bioluminescent bay, etc... there is so much to do.. dont just stay in your room and on the hotel beaches. explore!! We did and had an amazing time

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Great.”
Reviews.Author: MarthaSydney
Reviews.Content: It took us 33 hours travelling door to door to get to the Holiday Inn Express. We must have looked extremely exhausted because they gave us an early check in straight away. Much appreciated! We had 5 nights there (at least 3 days recovering from jetlag) and though it wasn't the best Hotel, the staff were friendly and the room clean. We also paid in Australia, higher price, big mistake. The breakfast was ok, though we had to wait for a table on 2 occasions. The pool was out of action due to renovations, an alternative Hotel pool was available. But we were there to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Near cruise terminal and Condado Beach”
Reviews.Author: RiverbendTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights pre-cruise. Great Location. Very Friendly helpful staff. Taxis no problem. Used bus to ride into town. No schedule for bus long wait. BUT too far to walk. Beach near by. Restaurants and Walgreen's very close. Breakfast just OK...

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice - go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Neatham
Reviews.Content: What a dump! I had a shabby, dingy, dirty room with a view of an appartment building opposite. It was very noisy, and despite being a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor, the room reeked of cigarettes. The room had electrical sockets hanging off the wall. I had a choice of trying to sleep in a hot and stuffy atmosphere or staying awake with the unbelievably noisy air-con. The pool is miniscule - you can barely fit two people in it for swimming. The pool area is tiny and shabby. I canÂ´t believe how much they charge for such rubbish. If you have a choice, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!! EMPLOYEE VERY RUDE MANAGER DON'T CARE”
Reviews.Author: tici1982
Reviews.Content: We could not get elevator to work to take us up. bellman waved us off , we thought to fix it, No he loads another guest on and takes our elevator!! And to add insult he laughs in our faces! I complained to front desk and the said they would notify manager. One month later i still have heard no response! APPARENTLY MANAGEMENT DOESN"T CARE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: macnirish
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was the most uncomplicated I've ever had. Every receptionist was kind and helpful. The breakfast was tasty and plentiful (as long as you were there by 8:00). Lobby decorum was very attractive. Rooms exceptionally clean and comfortable. We once brought in an embarassing amount of sand one evening. The next afterrnoon when we returned from our day, it was all gone. We had incredible luck with parking. Never once had to pay the $10 fee, were always able to find a street spot. I felt safe walking with my family in this area. An added bonus was the security guard on watch at the parking garage across the street. Walk to Condado main drag was simple. Restaurants abundant and tasty. Orocovis, Cafe de los Angeles (ate there twice it was so good, esp. crab mofongo) and the Greenhouse. All had kid-friendly cuisine. In the April issue of Que Pasa, a Holiday Inn add claimed that "they listened" to customer surveys. Indeed they have. Totally changed my perception of a Holiday Inn. Four star hotel at a three star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Condado”
Reviews.Author: steve_in_indy
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 3 nights for the San Juan portion of our vacation and again the last night before flying back. I think this hotel represents a great value for the area. The location is ideal as we think the Condado area is a good compromise between OSJ and the beach. There are many restaurants within walking distance and it was easy to catch the bus into OSJ (taxis as well if you prefer). [Ajili Mojili and La Ropa Vieja were our favorites.] The room was very clean and the beds and shower were nice (typical HI Exp). The bathroom was on the small side and didn't have the extra sink outside that you sometimes get. The room was fairly typical, but perhaps a little small. The pool was also small, but more than adequate for my kids. Beach access was 1.5 blocks away, but we didn't take advantage of that since we were going to Luquillo and Vieques later in our trip. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for (value, location) without paying high prices and resort fees. One word of caution: parking is precarious. They have a few slots but they are not easy to get into because of the parking across the street. If you can wait to get your car until you leave, then I would.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: hotsexybiker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here one nite before our cruise. It seemed a bit out of the way after we found our way around San Juan. If I would have known the city better I would have preferred to stay in " Old San Juan" which is closer to the Carnival Cruiseline Pier. It was not a bad locale- there is a little beach across the road and some nice upscale stores and a casino across the road, too. The room was clean but as I say, it was just ok. Puerto Rico is a facsinating, vibrant city with a lot to offer and next time I go I will know to stay in Old SJ. Thank you for taking the time to read the review and if you have any questions please don't hesitate to email me. Buena suerte!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, location and service”
Reviews.Author: SheriASeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed pre and post cruise and received excellent service, the front desk staff was delightful and more than willing to help us arrange a city tour. The bed was comfortable, the room clean and the location just right. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable”
Reviews.Author: gam888
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after our cruise. Small hotel, not luxurious, but good for the price we paid. Clean, good location, 5 minutes walk to the beach.Walking distance to restaurants and Walgreen. The only thing we were disappointed about is the breakfast selection. No cinnamon bums, no waffles, and the bananas were not fresh. It was a really low grade breakfast selection compared to other Holiday Inns we have stayed at. That is the major negative. Otherwise, there is free internet, free computer downstairs, and it's good for a pre and post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and post curise stay”
Reviews.Author: colormeelmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on either end of a cruise in March 2010 and it worked for our purposes. We knew each stay would be little more then enough time for a nights sleep so our focus was for something clean and low cost. At $141 a night it was far less then other places we looked up and what we saw of the hotel was very clean. Noise in the halls sounded like it was in your room. The staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. It rained both days we stayed there. They have a small, outside pool, which we didnâ€™t use. The area seemed safe enough but not very desirable, like much of what we saw of San Juan. The cabs cost a few dollars more then we had read but worked well getting us between airport, hotel and the ship. If we had had many hours to spend at a hotel I would have paid for a nicer one to enjoy but since almost all our time there was spent sleeping this hotel worked out just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LITTLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: PIRATE1960
Reviews.Content: We visited the Holiday Inn express for 2 days pre cruise. What a hidden gem for a moderate hotel. The staff is incredibly friendly and the rooms very clean. Also the breakfast is not bad at all as they serve hard boiled eggs, bagels, muffins,cereal,juice,and coffee. If you get in much after 8am you might have to stand in line as it does get busy and it is a small room. Lots of great restaurants within walkin distance. We loved Waikiki, Ajili Mojili, and lots of other places all within a 7-10 minute walk. There is also a liquor store nearby and a Walgreens. A great place at a great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: BeckyO2
Reviews.Content: Service was good an hotel staff was very friendly and accomodationg. Nice amenities at the hotel and good location in the heart of San Juan. The beach was walking distance and there were a lot of good local places to eat. Only down side was oor non-smoking room smelled like smoke and had do be recleaned when we got there, bc no more rooms were availiable for us to move to.

Reviews.Title: “DECENT PLACE TO STAY PRE OR POST CRUISE”
Reviews.Author: jeff013
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after returning from Rincon on the west coast where we stayed after our cruise of the Adventure of the Seas. We stayed to ensure that we were near to the airport for our flight home to the UK. Found the hotel to be nice and clean with decent rooms although they were rather small. The continental breakfast was rather bland with weak coffee but all things considered the hotel was good overall. They have parking but you can park in the street outside that saved us the parking charge. The hotel is close to the strip where we had dinner in an Argentinian restaurant called Mimi or somehting similar where the rib eye steak was to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Hotel stay was fine”
Reviews.Author: Paula S
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed 1 night in this hotel in January, pre cruise. The hotel is located in a good area in San Juan, with bars, restaurants and clubs and the beach in easy walking distance. Lady on reception was polite and helpful on arrival. Rooms were large, clean, HUGE bed was really comfortable. Aircon worked well, not too noisy, although airhandling unit leaked water onto the tiled floor in the morning. (No big deal). The room definitely did not smell of anything musty or otherwise. It was clean and absolutely fine. Continental breakfast was OK. Didnt like the fact they provided only plastic plates, cups and cutlery, but food was OK. We didnt use the pool but there is a small one and people were out there in the morning. All in all, based on the good price, as a 3 star equivalent hotel, I would def. stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Not good except Location”
Reviews.Author: psj11
Reviews.Content: Location is the only good thing about this hotel. The smell in the hotel and room was very bad. There was nice beach area nearby so i wanted to just spend time around there and I did not want to go back to room as it smelled very bad. small room, small bathroom. The bed was making noise. If you turn on the bed at night, it would make horrible noise and bed was not comfortable at all. There were so many bugs in the room and lobby area. Total 8 bugs bit me. So left the hotel and went to other hotel in the san juan area and there wasn't any such problem. Breakfast was ok too. Except location i dont see any value in going to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: laislapr
Reviews.Content: We stay one night on Dec 31st on two rooms, both very clean and comfortable located on 7th floor. The stay was great, the price was right considering the date $139 for a two double beds room. Location couldn't be better. We can't complain, except for the parking space, they only had 10 and we had to park about six streets away because of the many parties going on for New Years celebration on nearby hotels. The staff is very friendly and if you get up early you can have coffee, juices and pastries for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express Condado San Juan PR”
Reviews.Author: janet67
Reviews.Content: PRO'S*** Edith - OMG this women is a doll. She is really one of the nicest people I have ever met. We got there early and were allowed to check in early. We were also allowed to use there printer to print our boarding pass. The staff is definitely a five star staff. Within walking distance of the beach as well as some good restaurant. I recomend "Wakiki - reasonably priced and Buenos Ayres Good but expensive . Take a day & take the B21 or C53 bus across from the street on Ashford Ave to Old San Juan ( .75 Cents) the best restaurant there I would say is "Mojitos" 323 Calle Recinto Viejo San Juan. You will not regret it. Awesome food at reasonable prices. Also we did the Horse back riding at the "Tropical Trail Rides". We rode the horses. Awesome time. But more of a physical activity. Tell them Janet sent you. The room and bathroom were both very clean and everything worked. CON'S *** We got to the room and notice that the safety deposit box had no lock. Call the desk where we were informed that they only had 10 locks for the hole hotel. Thank god the staff is honest because I constantly left my valubles hidden in the draws when I went to the beach. The fitness has three crappy machine. I am physically active and ended up paying $15 to work out at the International Fitness Gym a couple of blocks down. The breakfast was OK after the first day I ended up sticking to cereal, banana and coffee. Get there early or you won't get a table. The Pool and Whirlpool are efficient .

Reviews.Title: “Rather expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: awBelgium
Reviews.Content: Prior to our cruise (Caribbean Princess) my husband and I stayed in this hotel for 1 night. Room was OK (double queen), but unpleasant smell and air conditioning much too noisy to leave on during the night. Very small pool - average breakfast. Good location. After the cruise we stayed at Hampton Inn Suites: much better and was a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location Location Location and Clean -Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Chulolaw
Reviews.Content: If location is your thing-keep in mind this is one block from the beach and it is about a 2 minute walk to Ashford Avenue, where restaurants, clubs and casinos are located. Within a few blocks from the Condado Hilton, Sheraton and Walgreens. I was able to get a parking spot in their lot for $10/night and the area is very safe, across from the Comfort Inn and I felt completely safe walking in the neighborhood at 2am by myself. Room is spotless and clean (we had a non-skg room) Also, ate breakfast 2 days, hours are really early despite the weekend. Not all the contents of the typical HIE but bagels, cereals, muffins and pastry and bananas/oatmeal. I would definitely make this my spot. I do not need an oceanfront hotel when the beach is a blk away. I do not need 4 star, you are visiting an island, with beautiful beaches, tourist locations and super friendly people, get out and explore. The staff is very helpful and went out of their way to make us comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff - comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: evang0
