Reviews.Content: We a group of 20 with teenagers, from Toronto - Canada, stay here at Holiday Inn Express - San Juan , prior our cruise. The room is clean, despite a bit smaller for a family of four. But who cares just for a one night stay prior cruise. Staff is very friendly, hotel is very clean, continental breakfast with a lot of variety but more than enough for a simple breakfast, close to the Ashford Avenue., where the night life locates and good restaurants , Walgreens drug mart / supermarket is within walking distant. Room rate is very cheap in compared with the Comfort Inn., Quality Inn... etc. Get every penny worth for the stay. Highly recommend to travellers for a short stay. (Eva Ng from Toronto, Canada - Sept 02, 2009)

Reviews.Title: “A convient location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: coreyhasan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 times while visiting San Juan,P.Rico. The hotel is located in Condado area. You are close to local restaurants,grocery store, beaches and casinos. Also, the local bus is accross the street from the hotel which takes you into Old San Juan for just $.75 each way. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and assisted with anything you need from basic needs to organizing day trip excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Beach, Just Don't Expect a Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mikes66682
Reviews.Content: The Positives: 1. Very close to Condado beaches, i.e. 5 minutes by foot. 2. Bus stop to Old San Juan nearby on Ashford Avenue (Bus B21 or C53) -- expect to wait 30 minutes or more for the bus and then it's about a 20 minute trip. 3. There is a pool and hot tub (though they're a bit on the small side). 4. Lots of restaurants in the area. 5. One of the few hotels in SJ with smoking rooms. The negatives: 1. Upon arrival, the hotel gave us a room that smelled rather musty and chemically, and then we saw that the bedsheets had what appeared to be dried blood on them. 2. The hotel did give us another room, but this one had a broken lock, i.e. the electronic lock stopped working and it took the maintenance guy almost half an hour to get us back into our room. 3. Breakfast isn't worth showing up for, just cheap pastries, cereal, and bananas; no ham, cheese, or anything. And if you do want to show up, do so by 8am, otherwise everything's gone and they don't refill the trays. 4. No fridge in the room, though there's an ice maching in the lobby. 5. Not a single room has a balcony. Bottom line, I thought this place was a bit overpriced, considering we visited in the off season. And the breakfast is just PITIFUL & PATHETIC. I wouldn't want to return here, unless I saw a really outstanding deal, i.e. considering the lackluster amenities, the hotel should drop its rates to below $100 per nite, then I might consider returning, otherwise I'd look elsewhere. If you're a beach person who just needs a bed at nite, then this place might do, but do look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “LAST MINUTE PLANS Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: princesaurora
Reviews.Content: It's a great place for family with small kids. Me, husband, 6y girl, & 3Y boy. With continental breakfast (eggs, bread,cold & hot cereal,juice, coffe . Dad & kids went to pool after breakfast, me cheking my e-mails. Lunch at any place around condado area. There's fast food or Restaurants you choose. Then beach 3min walking distance. There's an open space like a park at the other street for the kids to run, jump, feel fresh air. Dinner, the same walking to Chilli's, car to PizzaHut etc. At night kids to sleep and parents to enjoy together.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mrsosci
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and the staff fantastic. We were even upgraded to a suite. We had an extra bathroom, sitting room, microwave and frig. Nice surprise, but only their one night pre cruise. Short walk to a nice beach - if you have the time. The location is not the best for two reasons. By the time we paid cab fare for trips to Old San Juan we could have stayed at a closer location. It was $32 round trip. Then again $36 to port. The second is area where hotel is located. It was a bit of a walk to eating places. I didn't see any shopping at all except some food markets. In the evening I don't think I would walk very far at all. We went to the end of the street and there were some questionable people hanging about. The breakfast buffet is a challenge. When we arrrived there where kids running and pushing everywhere. Parents were not present. You could not find a seat or get anywhere near the food. We left and walked the 2 blocks to Subway. I wish we had stayed closer to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise spot”
Reviews.Author: Langroch
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed being 2 minutes from the beach since our cruise was only leaving at 10pm we spent the morning at the beach and then showered up and stored our luggage and walked around. this is a very good location for restos etc. we ate at 'angels' the night before - good local food. a small pool too was appreciated by our boys. a good spot for a one or two night stay max nice breakfast room

Reviews.Title: “Nice place pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: Crusinlions
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the HIE for 2 nights pre cruise. We have stayed here before and liked it. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The rooms are adequate for what we need. The breakfast is nice. You are a short walk from the beach and the bus is accessible to San Juan for .75.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean.”
Reviews.Author: bc_me
Reviews.Content: There's nothing fancy about this hotel, but it offers everything you would expect from a Holiday Inn and it made a perfect base for our three days in San Juan. Plus the free breakfast, although not particularly exciting, was invaluable. It was so nice to just be able to get up and go without worrying about where to get breakfast on the cheap. It was also strangely difficult to find produce in San Juan, so those free bananas were sometimes the only fresh fruit we saw all day! We also very much appreciated the free 24-hour internet access on the business centre computers. The pool and jacuzzi are small but nice, and the hotel will lend out beach towels. Rooms don't have a fridge or a minibar, but there is a coffee maker, cable TV, in-room safe, and a totally effective air conditioner. The bathroom was not huge, but there was some counter space and a full-size tub. The beds were the same extra-comfy ones found in Holiday Inns everywhere. Everything was clean and no-frills but perfectly nice. The neighborhood, Condado, is lively at night with lots of awesome restaurants just a little ways down Ashford Ave, and we never felt too dodgy walking around there, even after dark. Plus the Condado beach is maybe half a block from the Holiday Inn Express, and for my money it was a nicer beach than the one in Isla Verde, if not as large or populous. It was very easy to catch the bus to Old San Juan, and hailing a taxi in ther area was never a problem. The reception desk was happy to call a cab for us on the morning that we left, and they also book a variety of tours including the one we took to El Yunque rainforest. Overall, this probably isn't the best hotel for your honeymoon, but for our group of three friends mostly interested in sightseeing and going out, this was a nice, affordable base of operations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Post Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: sagacioustraveler
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, affordable post cruise hotel. We arrived at hotel about 10:00am. Even though posted check in time is 4:00pm they had us in a room before 11:00am! Room was fair sized, high ceilings and even a slight ocean and lagoon view. They have a small pool and whirlpool. Location is across the street from a park and beach and around the corner from Gucci and other high end shops. Walking distance from Walgreens, Wendy's, and many restaurants. Compared to our pre-cruise stay in Old San Juan, significantly quieter. Some street noise but relatively quiet. If we ever do another cruise from San Juan, I would definitely stay here pre-cruise rather than Old San Juan as its much quieter and a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “For The Location and Price, You Can't Beat It!”
Reviews.Author: Lovely1722
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5/8-5/11 for partners birthday. The location is great-luxury shopping around the corner (Cartier, Gucci, etc) and less than 1/2 a block from the beach. Rooms were larger than expected and the beds were very comfortable. The free breakfast was better than expected (rolls, danish, coffee, juice, etc) but who wants a HUGE breakfast when you are going to the beach. You can walk to resturants and nightlife was either in walking distance of a short cab ride away. One minor gripe: The air conditioning unit was one of the loudest I have ever heard! If you tried to turn it off, the humdity would make you uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely go back here”
Reviews.Author: masqueofreason
Reviews.Content: larger room than I expected but would have liked a microwave, excellent staff, clean rooms and comfy beds

Reviews.Title: “awesome value!!”
Reviews.Author: CHALEA
Reviews.Content: super location ..great staff ..decient breakfast and pool.. the rooms are plenty big enough for 2 and very clean and comfy!! a great bargin for a super location!! and free in room internet..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JeffMLS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while in San Juan. The rooms are clean, but small. The hotel has a decent pool and hot tub and is located just one block from the beach. There are numerous restaurants and gift shops within walking distance. The hotel employees were very nice and helpful. For the cost, this hotel is a good choice when staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Lise0763
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for an extra 4 nights stay in San Juan after a cruise. The location was perfect. 3 minutes walk to the beach. 5 minutes walk to the Casino at La Concha hotel. Close to many restaurants. The only thing I could say was that the room was small and the outdoor pool always in the shade because the pool was surrounded by high ciment walls and the hotel is also surrounded by high buildings

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise with only a minor gripes”
Reviews.Author: Younger64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for one night pre cruise with a 13 year and 11 year old. Stayed in a room with two doubles. Service was good, breakfast was included, and really only a couple issues - the A/C was very loud (one of those units that is under the window). We would have turned it off and opened a window (since we were on a high floor) but the windows did not open. The room was small, but housekeeping managed to get the roll away to fit, along with all of our suitcases. Hotel is not close to great beaches, so wouldn't recommed it for an extended beach related stay Asked for and recieved a roll away bed for one of the kids no charge - arrived promptly. Front desk staff were competent and friendly. Seemed like a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bebrbabe
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed 1 night pre-cruise Feb 2009. Yes, the rooms and elevators are small but the value for the money is excellent. Terrific location right off Condado Beach, near shopping for those last minute purchases. Nice open air restaurants on the beach, very well patrolled and seemed safe for walking. The continental breakfast was also a nice plus, as was the free internet service. The hotel seemed very clean and staff was friendly and helpful. I would guess that parking would be tough if you have a car, but if you're going by taxi it makes it easy as they're readily available. Over to the Pan American Pier for our family of 4 + luggage was only $20. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulubellAlberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night prior to our cruise. Although our room was small and the bathroom very small, it was clean and comfortable. The location is perfect for a nice stroll on the beach in the morning although there seems to be a lot of cops around on the side streets. The breakfast was good but make sure you are there before it closes as they promptly whisked the food away at 10:00. The staff were friendly and efficient especially on Sunday morning when there were several people checking out and people arriving from cruise ships to check in for a post cruise stay. We lounged around the pool after breakfast before we had to grab a taxi to take us to the ship. There were several there waiting so we didn't have to call or wait for one. We would stay here again for a pre-cruise stay, the price was right and so is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are going on a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Yammer1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel before we went on a cruise. The room was large info and very clean. I think they must have renovated recently. The staffs were friendly and helpful. There is free high speed internet. The continental breakfast was good. All your basic food groups. The price was reasonable $112/U.S. + tax. Total around $146 Canadian. We were on the 5th floor. It is close the port and there were other people that were going on the same ship as we so we spit a taxie which was $10 U.S. each. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, if you don't have a car.”
Reviews.Author: Elynne
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express San Juan is in a good location in the Condado area. It is not right on the beach, but more like across the street from Condado beach. Rooms were small (bathroom especially). But staff was friendly and helpful and everything was clean. The biggest issue with this hotel is parking. If you have a car you can TRY to find street parking or else pay to park in the limited amount of parking spaces that the Comfort Inn has for about ten dollars a night. Apparently the Holiday Inn Express has several parking spaces available but we were never able to reserve one (even though no cars were ever parked in them). The only other complaint is that we asked for a wake up call on our last morning as we had to catch an early flight and they called six minutes late. I think this place was fine for us and we really didn't spend much time there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice room, good price, nice reception service”
Reviews.Author: Tryciunai
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed there for 2 nights. We booked it from Expedia, so we got a deal for 114US/night. That was a really good offer, because ir was already Christmas season. Room was renovated and quite nice, despite that there is no nice view from the window :) We loved breakfast on a terace. Receptionists were very helpful and friendly. I think thats really good quality for price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: butterfly63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early January. This was our second stay so we knew what to expect and we were pleased we chose this hotel again. Two very comfortable double beds, good ac, clean bathroom which has been partially updated (solid surface countertops) and a small refrigerator, coffee maker etc. The pool was very clean but unheated; the hot tub was hot! The breakfast was the usual stuff; lousy coffee and cheap pastries but plenty of fresh bananas... at least it's free! The hotel is a two minute walk from the beach and is just around the corner from the most upscale shops in Condado including Cartier, Gucci and Louis Vuitton. We ate at a local Mexican restaurant called Tijuana. Food was very good (B+) and the margaritas were excellent but next time I'll ask the price! ($30 for the cocktail to share.. it was good but no that good!). We ate lunch at the nearest Japanese/Chinese restaurant (Sukiake?) opposite La Concha hotel. Food was inexpensive and pretty good (C++) Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Walgreens, and many local restaurants are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was not happy”
Reviews.Author: phylli
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed at the Hoilday Inn Express.The room smelled so bad I could not sleep.And the T.V. did not work the sound kept going down and I would have to keep turning it back up and some time there was no sound at all.I was a little sad that the shops was not open on a Sunday.The beach was fun it was right across the street if it wasn't for that I would have to sleep out side the pool.We stayed out as long as we could. I was only there for one night I could not stay another night.It was clean too.The price was o.k. would not stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Madforsalsa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a night prior to a cruise and a night following. The front desk was polite and helpful and the rooms were clean. The queen-bed room we had the first night was a little small, but the king-bed room the second night was fine. Note that check-in is actually 4:00PM, not 3:00PM as the Holiday Inn website claims. However, we were able to get our room on each day a few hours earlier and they stored our luggage in a back room until the room was ready. As already noted here, the continental breakfast was not impressive and the room it was in was a little too small. The best thing about the place is that it is only about two minutes walk from a nice beach in front of the La Concha Resort. The beach is adjacent to a park. Even though the beach is not associated with the hotel, I would have to consider its proximity as one of the attractions of staying here. The hotel is also very close to a number of restaurants with a wide range of prices. Old San Juan is also reasonably close. You could take the bus there, but you might have to wait a while depending on the day and time. You can probably snag a taxi there for a little over $10 if you negotiate with the driver (note that you can't negotiate fares when you leave the airport or a cruise ship). You could spend more money at a resort like the La Concha or the Caribe Hilton, but I don't see what it would gain you.

Reviews.Title: “Very congested and UNinviting staff/ambience”
Reviews.Author: fjarens
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one nite with 9 family members before taking a cruise. The lobby & all rooms including dinning/breakfast were very small. Place is always packed with tourist groups and crammed. Staff was VERY unfriendly and quite rude when I provided them with my Priority Club membership--there were of no help organizing my bill on time and providing me with extra towels & pillows. DO NOT STAY HERE !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Gary C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Holiday Inn Express on Condado for two nights after our cruise. The location; although kind of hidden in a side-street, it's attached to a main road which is a 75 cents bus ride to old San Juan. If you bump into a bunch of tourists at the bus stop, you can all probably split the cost of a $12 (fixed-cost) taxi ride to Old San Juan. The hotel was very accommodating to our needs. We arrived at 10 in the morning; we were not allowed to check in because our rooms were not ready but they held our luggage for us and provided useful brochures of the nearby area. We toured Old San Juan and came back in the late afternoon to check in. They were apologetic for not allowing us to check in earlier (even though it was not their fault!) and also gave us a nice room. We got a room on the 7th floor in the corner of the building - with a nice view to the ocean and beach, and a tall roof. The room was also very spacious and the a/c cooled us from the blazing Caribbean temperatures. The front desk were informative and provided us a recommendation to the local shops and restaurants. They provided us information on transportation to various locations on the island and on other activities. I recommend this hotel to anyone who's joining the cruise as its location is convenient and its staff is very professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IMURPO
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay here one night before and one night after a cruise. The taxis are regulated & it's $16 to the hotel from the airport. There are usually several cruise guests staying here, so all in one van to the port was $5/each. The rooms are smaller, but the hotel location is prime. No need to taxi to shopping, food or the beach: it's all on the next block. They held our luggage post-cruise until check-in time at 4pm. The breakfast is a little disappointing when compared to other Holiday Inn Express hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are Correct”
Reviews.Author: linzee32
Reviews.Content: They claim the hotel is on the beach, not true. Previous posters who mention low showerheads were not kidding. I am 6 feet tall and nailed my head on the showerhead. Rooms were TINY. Smelled very musty. We had ROACHES in our room, these things were massive. Continental breakfast was basic- bagels, juice, cereal and fruit. Pool was also small. First class shoppiong is around the corner like stated. You have to take a cab to Old San Juan, its not within walking distance. If you are just coming in for a cruise then stay here. if you are staying for an extended period suck it up and pay the extra money for the Marriott. I was travelling for work and was unable to stay in a hotel with Casino in its title. We were also looking for low cost. The rates at this hotel are some of the lowest in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wyomingirl
Reviews.Content: Came in late on a red eye after missing connection to San Juan. At 6 am Jean was at the front desk with a wonderful smile and great hospitality. He welcomed us and told us to help ourselves to breakfast, stored our luggage and let us wait by the pool until a room was available. By 9:30 am we were in a room and getting some much needed sleep. Thanks so much to JEAN!! Now for the room it was a corner room #315 and was clean and comfortable. The bed was soft, the pillows outstanding and we had plenty of room for the 2 of us. There was a window in the tiny bathroom that looked out to the lagoon. The shower was nice and strong and refreshing after a full day of travel. Although the towels were standard issue the soaps and shampoos were nice. The pool area is kept very clean, although it is small, and the loungers make for an enjoyable end to the day. The breakfast was more than adequate and met all of our needs. There was always plenty of food available. Our luggage was stored all day while we enjoyed Puerto Rico before heading out on our cruise. What a nice convenience to have at no extra charge. All in all this hotel is excellent if you are looking for a budget friendly hotel with outstanding customer service and a relaxing atmosphere in the heart of the condado shopping area. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone unlike our post visit to Condado Plaza (read my review there).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Hikermeister
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in the Condado area of San Juan is not cheap (San Juan is a very expensive city) but it offers great value. We stayed two nights in April before our Southern Caribbean cruise. Getting to San Juan from Western Canada is a trial, and your chances of making your ship on the same day are slim, but you would be cheating yourself to miss out on one of the most beautiful cities in the Western hemisphere, comparable to Quebec City. (both are walled with narrow, ancient streets) I was a little afraid to book, having read some negative reviews on this site, however my fears were quickly dispelled. Most of the complaints were about the rooms being small for 4 people. Yes, I would hate to have 4 people in such a room, but that would apply most anywhere. The room is a tad small, but really OK for a couple. Our room was beautiful, with a partial ocean view. It had the finest bedding, mattress and pillows we have ever seen in any hotel, and a great shower. The free Internet and continental breakfast were real plusses. We didnâ€™t use it, but there was a nice outdoor pool. There was no restaurant, but there are several good restaurants close by and it is a safe neighbourhood. We dined at a rustic sea side restaurant with huge breakers crashing on the rocks just outside the open window. Itâ€™s a short taxi ride to the old town and forts, the airport or the cruise docks. The only downside was the paper thin walls. If you had loud neighbours it would not be good news. I would definitely recommend it, and hope this is typical for the chain, because we are booked into another Holiday Inn Express in Glasgow this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: NancyG13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our cruise. Hotel is in the Condado area. Not as busy as downtown. Beautiful beach and lots to see on a nice walk. A lot of construction going on in the area. Not noisy at night though. Cab ride from airport was approx. $20 for 3 people with 3 bags. Check in was quick and easy. Room was very nice, big enough for 3 people with 3 large bags for our cruise. Clean and comfortable. Beds were some of the most comfy we have ever slept on. Nice duvets etc. Upgraded toiletries. Pool and hot tub were clean, and not too cold. Elevators are a bit small. We did however fit 3 of us and our luggage on it. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Cereal, juice, toast, bagels etc. Busy near closing time. Check was very quick and easy. There are a lot of cabs there ready to take you to the pier or downtown to shop or sightsee. A great, non stressful way to start our cruise. Walgreeens, Starbucks, etc all within a 10-15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Makaylalove
Reviews.Content: Some one already mentioned basing your rating depending on what you paid and I think that is smart. All hotels seem over priced in San Juan. This one was far better for the same price we paid at the Howard Johnson where we also stayed. Yes, the rooms are small, but since all of our time was out exporing and not in the room playing basketball, it was of adequate size with two double beds. It was very clean and comfortable. The location was great. The beach and restaurants were a block away as well as the upscale shops (including Gucci & Dior). The bus stop was one block away and for $0.75 you could ride anywhere including Old San Juan. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was pleasant. The free breakfast selections were far superior to another hotel. There were cereals, hot & cold. Toast, rolls and other breakfast breads. A variety of fruits and drinks, plus eggs and waffles. The staff will keep your bags after you checked out if you have time left to explore. So o.k. the elevator was very small. Did I need a bigger one?: No.

Reviews.Title: “small but good price”
Reviews.Author: c_lynn129
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was clean & most all areas of the hotel are on the smaller side. The elevators are absolutely tiny; so if you have a lot of luggage, plan on a few trips. We took the stair more then once from the 3rd floor....got sick of waiting for the elevators to have enough room for us. The bathroom was on the small side...ok so maybe it is the smallest I have ever seen. Great location, but if you are going to be in this area for longer then a few days, I would try to find a place with more room. There were 4 of us in the room and it did feel a little cramped. Great for a one nite stay, but not longer. There are better places to stay for a few nites. We stayed 4 nites just a few blocks down and got a 2bed 2bath appartment, with full kitchen for just 50 more a nite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: aklages
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express one night on our honeymoon. We boarded a cruise ship the next day. The rooms are so tiny! We could barely get our two middle sized suitcases in the door. The bathroom was even smaller. If you are taller than 6'1--beware! My husband is exact 6' and he struggled to fit in the bathroom. The toliet is positioned very close to the wall. There is also a disco next door and it starts hopping around midnight--the time we were trying to go to bed. There was a coffee maker in the room but no outlet. There was also no bathroom vent. It was clean and centrally located. The staff was nice and helpful. They directed us to two great restaurants--all in walking distance. Also, taxis are always outside--which is nice. The hotel stored our luggage for no charge while we toured the city. Our cruise ship did not leave until 10pm so we had all day to tour. The hotel staff gave us directions to the Old City and travel tips. Overall--I would not stay there again because of the room size, price and the disco noise. We paid almost $200 for one night--we booked online. It was not worth it! While we were checking in, other travelers were being charged $99 a night. So--call and book direct, do not book over the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, better than expected but not perfect either.”
Reviews.Author: AuntyL
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us booked at the Holiday Inn pre-cruise on 2/8/08. The two of us arrived three hours prior to check-in time & were able to get in our room then. Overall, the hotel was clean & most all areas of the hotel are on the smaller side. The elevators are absolutely tiny; so if you have a lot of luggage, plan on a few trips. The location is very good, lots of semi-expensive places to eat, convenience stores, Subway, Baskin Robbins, Walgreens etc - all in a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast (in a room too small for the volume of people) was nothing more than a snack if you are looking for a real meal. Overall, the night of Feb 8th was fine. Now, to our post-cruise night there on Feb 16th - we arrived early (9:30am) after our cruise, let the front desk know we were there, had them hold our luggage, ask when a room would be ready & were told a couple of hours. We took off to tour El Morro (really cool) & San Cristobal (there's a free trolley between the two forts too); returned to the hotel about 1:30pm. We were told no rooms were ready yet, but as soon as a room was available we could check-in; so we hung around & waited. At the same time, we watched person after person (whose luggage was also being held for them) get checked into their rooms. At just about 4pm (official check-in time) we were told our room was ready. Personally, we feel they kept us waiting until 4pm on purpose. We were polite the entire time we waited and have no idea why we were made to wait like we did as others got into their rooms; but this did not make us happy at all. As a side note, the Comfort Inn is right door - might try that next time as it's a little cheaper too.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy beds, clean, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Jbauer1210
Reviews.Content: A friend and I needed to escape Ohio's winter and were looking for an inexpensive option in San Juan. This hotel is in a safe area, across the street from the beach. We walked down the beach to the Mariott's beach and lounged there, they gave us free beach chairs. The room was clean and comfortable, comfy beds, good water pressure. The pool is small, but clean. The staff were very helpful and polite, helping us book a tour of El Yunque, and giving us good restaurant recommendations. It's a $12 cab ride to Old San Juan. There are shops and restaurants within walking distance. We also liked the Mariott, it has a nice beachfront, bar, pool and casino. Next time I'll probably stay there if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!!”
Reviews.Author: cruiers5
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at this hotel. I had read some very negative reviews of the hotel and wasn't expecting a good experience. The hotel lobby and room were very clean. The beds and bedding were first rate. The rooms weren't super large - but we were going to go on a cruise, so we weren't bothered with a smaller room. Noise level was good in hotel. The breakfast in the morning was good. They kept it well stocked and were cleaning the counters all the time. The only problem was trying to find a place to sit, but there were trays that you could take the food back to your room. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but pricey - we were pleasantly surprised......”
Reviews.Author: Ramjet1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night post cruise - we had 5 couples from Ohio, Wisconsin, and Maryland. Rooms were clean but small - elevator is even smaller! Very convenient to the Condado Beach and to some very nice upscale stores (Louis Vitton, Cartier, etc.) We were fortunate in that they gave my wife and I a room on the 7th floor overlooking the beach area. Beach is approximately 4-5 minute walk - very easy to get too. Price was somewhat high we thought until we saw the convenience to the water, shops, and restaurants. Pool is OK - not much sun since the hotel is surrounded by taller buildings. Continental breakfast is fine - nothing special but adequate. We are returning for a cruise this September, and we like San Juan so much that we are staying 2 nights - post cruise. Unfortunately this property is now charging $200 per night with all of the taxes and add-ons for 2 people in a room. Too rich for us - unless the price comes down - so we will stay at the Comfort Inn for $135 night and spend the savings on food and drink!.........

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect hotel pre and post cruise”
Reviews.Author: Joywrk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location for a pre and post cruise stay. The room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom is tiny but serviceable. I asked for extra towels and they came quickly. We didn't use the pool. The area was good for a walk with a small grocery store nearby. We followed staff recommendations for dinner and there was lots of choices nearby. Staff was pleasant and helpful We paid $144 a night which is high for this type of acccomodation but not for San Juan. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: czojf
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is well located near Ashford Avenue/Condado Beach, we were extremely displeased from the beginning. I am a Priority Club Member and have been staying in HIE on multiple occasions. I thought I knew what to expect. Unfortunately, not... We were given a ridiculously small room right next to the elevator (519, if you ever go there, try to avoid this room... but better is to try to avoid this hotel...). The room was very noisy and poorly decorated. When we asked for a change, the front desk told us we were out of luck but they couldn't do anything. The bathroom was so small and we couldn't open the door without hitting the TV stand... The staff looked like they didn't care when we asked them for assistance and didn't even seem to bother that I cancelled the rest of my stay after only one night there. I'm usually a big fan of Holiday Inn Express with their convenient rooms and complimentary full breakfast but this location was clearly disapointing. The only bright spots, the breakfast and the pool area which looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive lodging option at a great location”
Reviews.Author: RockyBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Express for 5 days and had a great experience... The hotel is in a great location if you want to be closer to Old San Juan in an inexpensive way. It is right at the western tip of the Condado area, just where Old San Juan begins. Easier to get a cab anytime/anywhere during the day and there's also a bus service B21 to Old San Juan from Ashford Ave across the hotel. There is a nice park and a beach across the hotel, one of the better beaches in San Juan area. Lot's of breakfast/lunch/dinner options in the vicinity starting with standard options such as Subway, Wendy's, Chilis, Fudruckers to some high end ones such as Buddatai. The hotel serves a splendid continental breakfast. Restaurants serving good Puerto Rican cuisine are also available in the vicinity. The food at these places is great but the service is VERY lacking. Case in point: Cafe De Angel on Ashford Ave (watch out for the 15% gratuity for serving just two persons). Condado area has a good night life too. Waikiki, Sol Del Luna and Kali on Ashford Ave are some good bar/lounge options. FInding a place to park the car can be a hassle. The hotel has some limited spaces available which are on a first come first served basis @$10 a day. However, you can easily find parking on one of the inner streets neighboring the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - walk to the beach, boutiques, and casino”
Reviews.Author: DCChiq
Reviews.Content: Weekend stay - quick trip to Puerto Rico for vacation. 4 travelers (couples), ages 25 - 32. Loved: --> Location - easy walk to the beach (less than 5 minutes), 10 minute walk to the Radisson's casino, 5 minute walk to some higher end boutiques. The restaurants nearby weren't worth walking to - take a $10 cab to Old San Juan instead. --> The closest beach(5 minutes) was the most convenient beach. It had lounge chairs for rent and bar service on the beach. The beach was clean and the water was warm with big waves. Not crowded at all, so no people watching. It was a gay beach and it was clean and safe. --> Good bang for our buck. Hotel room was clean, simple, easy to get to. Wasn't crazy about: --> The crowd at the hotel was very "touristy". It was the older hawaiian shirt wearing, birkenstock having, loud question asking, scared to walk outside in the dark - type of crowd. Very "first time out of the country" type.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Maxim
Reviews.Content: It was just for a night but the room was a little nicer than I had prepared myself for. Small but fairly comfortable. I wouldn't want to stay there for a vacation because it had absolutely no atmosphere and was like any 3 star hotel, anywhere in the world. But it doesn't try for anything more than that - it's just a Holiday Inn and you know what you'll get.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Scrabidee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mini 4-day vacation in Puerto Rico. Stood at this hotel in the Condado area. Was very satisfied with my stay. Hotel was very clean, rooms were very very nice and clean. Queen size beds have pillow top mattresses with down comforters of which I was impressed because other hotels give you those ugly bedspreads with ugly blankets. Alot of construction going on but that seems to be going on everywhere. The staff was very pleasant, taxis available at all times, easy to get around if you don't want to rent a car. Pool was very nice and clean with the beach within a block of the hotel. I would definitely stay there again and I do highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “near 3rd world country status”
Reviews.Author: 911TechWV
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying here for work, so I don't get many choices. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, my room is about 20' x 15, it has a bathroom that when I sit on the toilet, my knees are in the wall. The breakfast doesn't even include standard items such as cinammon rolls, hard boiled eggs, and name brand cereals. I am eating 3rd world country cereal. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone other than small people who wouldn't want to spend the extra $30 a night at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, close to nice beach, difficult parking, over priced”
Reviews.Author: southsidegirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice, but has some of the problems that many San Juan hotels have. The parking is very difficult, and costly. The room was overpriced, but probably not for the area it was in. Restaurants and shops within walking distance. Nice area close to beautiful beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: luckygamer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Condado section of San Juan, just one block off of main tourist area of Old San Juan. It is just a short ride from the airport, and cost $16 to get to the hotel. This facility is within walking distance of many casinos, attractions, and restaurants. There is a convenience store just around the corner for last minute items, soft drinks, etc. Staff at the hotel was courteous and accomodating. Cabs readily available at curbside, however, front desk will beckon one for you within minutes if all are in use. Made friends with facilities employee who pointed me in the right direction for a great lunch at a nearby local's cafe. He went out of his way to follow up to see if I found it OK, and if his recommendation was to my liking! Area is well supported by tourism police, and at all times felt safe. The area was clean, and well maintained, with a beautiful urban park across the street. Rooms were clean and bathroom was exceptionally clean! Bed was comfortable, and the linens were crisp. We had plenty of towels available during our stay. Only negative was there was only one ice machine, and it was down in the lobby. Continental breakfast was available, however, small serving area and large crowd of other guests deterred from trying it....chose to go to Dunkin' Donuts just 2 blocks walk from the hotel. Pricing was reasonable in comparison of other options nearby. Received AARP discount, totaling $127 for all taxes.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: alan03
Reviews.Content: nothing fancy. If you like fanchy shmantzy-this hotel is not for you. Great location, friendly staff, nice size rooms, safe area

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyorbit
Reviews.Content: This is a great value in San Juan! The hotel is located just around the corner from the fashionable Ashford Ave. which has great shopping and restaurants and is across the street from the beach. The room was clean and comfortable and stay was fine also. Only problem was that there parking was a bit difficult to use: you have to chain your spot shut and usually there are taxis parked in front of it so you can't get in anyway. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: acee53
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located in the Condado area, a few minutes from the airport. Price is a little high but comparing to other hotels in the area, is reasonable. Parking is on the street and hard to find sometimes. Associates are courteous. Rooms are clean although bathrooms are small compared to other hotels. Can easily walk to restaurants and beaches. I felt safe at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: OntarioNathan
Reviews.Content: Very clean Nice place to stay for one night before cruise. Great value! Ask for AAA rate. (Makes a big difference!) No complaints! Btw, they even will hold your luggage for later check-out if you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: crazymel98
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights to attend a wedding in the condado area. I have no complaints about this hotel. Booked my room as an advanced purchase, and checked in late and had no problems. Room was small but clean. The breakfast was a regular continental breakfast, but the coffee and milk were hot, and the bagels and pastries were fresh. The staff was very helpful. We needed directions to the church about 20 minutes before we had to leave and one of the workers came to our room and helped us out ;). The only minor issue is the parking. Street parking is available but limited, however since I went on an off-peak weekend, I was able to use the hotels tiny lot for $10/ day. Overall, its a good place for a short stay. If you are looking for a luxury, resort style place, this is not for you. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Piescobar
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed there one night prior to a cruise. The rooms are small, but really clean. Great location in Condado. The breakfast buffet is small, but plentiful. The front desk staff were really helpful and they held our bags in storage while we toured Old San Juan prior to our boarding our ship. I would stay here again. Great Mexican resturant about 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Garwaii
Reviews.Content: It is not the most luxurious, it does not have the most amenities and the locale has it's issues. However, the staff was amazingly pleasant and helpful, cheerful and downright fun! I had a blast chatting with Maggie at the tours desk and I believe her name to be either Iris or Aida (memory falters) at the front desk. They just loved the fact that I get lost everywhere and made all kinds of strip maps for me to get places (altho I managed to oblige and get lost anyway...they loved it). The cleaning staff was excellent, always leaving the room impeccable and they were quite friendly when you engage them in conversation. Tipping always helps with service and here was no exception. Continental breakfast was much better than I expected and my little boy loved having his hard boiled egg almost daily...blech..lol.. The staff there kept that area immaculate. There was always a local paper to read, either in spanish or english. I was too busy to use the pool, being rather high strung, pools don't always relax me, but the families using it seemed to have a good time. What was not quite so fun...the parking situation. Good luck finding a spot during the day. In the evening, you may luck out. I took the car out minimally because it was just easier to travel via bus or by tour group. Driving in San Juan was scary, even for this NYC driver. The room was very small, just one bed for myself and 10 year old, but the bed was huge. The closet in the room could not even fit my suitcase in it. But I had a nice corner room and the view was great! However, I would stay here again. My needs are minimal and I'd much rather be out and about than sitting in a luxurious hotel anyday. my hotel needs are basically clean room, clean shower and clean bed. This had all three. I saved money, used it on souvenirs! I love these ladies I met there! They made my stay great!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ridgeschips
Reviews.Content: We found the Holiday Inn Express a nice, comfortable place for our pre and post cruise stay (Feb. 2007). It was close to restaurants, shops and a nice small beach area was within walking distance. I read some of the reviews posted on this site and found them very helpful. We took the ferry and then a taxi to the Bacardi Rum factory. Although the tour is free, the prices of the Rum are more expensive than buying it at a store.The free samples were great however ! I will definitely go back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent, Safe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwrig
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night before leaving on a cruise the next day. Tough to find, look for tower. Very nice, helpful staff, they will store your luggage while you explore waiting for your cruise. Very little parking, but Avis rental place across the street. Small but clean rooms, good cont. breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lolasaidee
Reviews.Content: I have to strongly disagree with the last review. We stayed at this hotel after our cruise, and the location was awesome. It is within walkig distance to alot of resturants and only a block from the beach. There is a small park where kids go to enjoy the fountain showers and there is a little lagoon adjacent to the main beach where you can enjoy the beach with kids with little waves activity compared to the main beach where the waves are very aggressive. You have Chillis restaurnat close by, and you have Tony Romas. In addition, Old San Juan is very close. You have a market for quick items on the corner. You will find that the area will be filled with people walking around, jogging and enjoying the location. You have Walgreens 2 blocks away and other local resturants, Try Latin Star. As far as the Hotel, the room was very very clean and we are very picky. The bed was great, and the elevators, lobbies very clean. hotel staff was very helpful with securing a tour and holdig our luggage while our room was ready and the day of our departure. I will definetly stay here again, very nice hotel and very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rachallen
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel the night before our cruise on the Carnival Destiny. We used Holiday Inn rewards points for our stay. The hotel is close to a beach, but much of the beach area is a rocky shore. The taxi ride from the airport to the hotel was $19.50 and the taxi ride to the airport with 6 large bags was $25. The taxi to Old San Juan was $12. Don't miss the forts! The room was nice and clean. The only downside to this hotel was that checking in and out was unbelievably slow! The computers w/ internet free of use was nice and the small pool and hot tub were not crowded. Continental breakfast was good, just like any holiday inn express, except no cinnamon rolls. Having a Walgreen's 3 blocks away was nice and there were some good restaurants in that same area. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price- for one night”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express,Condado Beach area for one night post cruise in March. The staff was friendly. The rooms were nice. We had a corner room with a desk. It was clean and adequate in size. The beds were great for sleeping. We were on the top floor so, noise was not a problem. The pool was very small but clean and private. There was a nice little beach about a half of a block away. It was a small city park beach but, we enjoyed it. The area was safe. The free continental breakfast consisted of cold cereals, bagels, toast, juice and coffee. There was internet access but, no printer. It is a good, clean hotel for a pre or post cruise night. It is not too far from the San Juan ports or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again unless absolutely necessary.”
Reviews.Author: paradocsND
Reviews.Content: I must say that I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. After trying unsuccessfully to book online, we called Holiday Inn Express directly and booked two rooms by phone. We clearly stated our need for at least one room that could sleep four people. We arrived about 2am after a very long flight. Upon arrival, the hotel gave us our two rooms. We were to have 4 people in one room and two in the other. Although the rooms were for a "maximum of 4" people, there was only one bed in each. Although the desk clerk looked for a cot, I doubt it would have fit in the room anyway. The staff found us another room, for an extra charge, one floor down for our children, which was not at all optimal, but they had no more rooms for 4 people. Our other party of two stayed two floors down. As mentioned, the rooms were incredibly tiny. The bathroom almost left no room to sit on the toilet (and we are quite fit). The bed was nice, with comfy sheets and usual HIE accessories in the room. We had a tiny window that looked out onto a small street and then onto another building. Noises were quite easily heard from outside the room. Of course there were lots of people leaving and moving about, but we had just arrived and wanted to sleep. Parking was $10/night. The lot was very tight and had concrete barriers to navigate through in order to park the vehicle. Our van was not ready the night we arrived so the rental agency brought it to us the next morning. The man from the agency scratched up the entire side of the van trying to navigate between the parking blocks, which must be meant to keep others from parking there. Breakfast was adequate. There were none of the nice cinnamon rolls that HIE is noted for, however. The dining area was congested and poorly serviced. We had to clean our table before eating, and the trash bins were overflowing. On the positive side, a lengthy discussion with a manager resulted in cancellation of the charges for the third room. This was especially nice since they had not been the cause of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: CouleeCat
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the location (Condado) and rate, $95 per night. The room was ordinary, nothing fancy but clean and reasonably decent size. We were surprised that there was no bedspread on the bed, but it was made up fresh and tidy with the white linens. Even though it was a corner room, we did find that the noise from the housekeepers in the morning traveled through the walls. Loved the hot water and pressure in the shower and the big fluffy towels. Also loved the complimentary, cold bottled water in the refrigerator that was replenished every day. Breakfast was very good, as are most Holiday Inn Expresses, and served in a nice room off the lobby overlooking the secluded pool area. We saw a couple people use the trays to take their breakfast pool-side. There were warm hard-boiled eggs, pastries, hot and cold cereals and ample fresh fruit and juice. If you are going to El Morro, you can catch the bus just about a block from the hotel- ask at the front desk for the bus number. If you enjoy walking, you can actually walk to Old San Juan from here but it's quite a trek. I did though, in flip-flops and I'm in my 50's and very sedentary. We caught a taxi to come back at the set rate of $12. If you are in to shopping the luxury stores like Cartier, Gucci, etc., they are right around the corner (but then if you are shopping at these places, you probably aren't staying at a HIE!) If you are planning on renting a car and touring the island after staying in San Juan, this hotel is located just across the street from the Avis Rental offices. You can pick up your car here and drop it at the airport at no additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “clean with no frills”
Reviews.Author: DeborahVJ
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express in the Condado area of San Juan is a clean, comfortable, quiet hotel. A continental breakfast is served, but there is no restaurant. I would recommend this hotel for a one-night stay, but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaniNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico where we spent 10 days at the Holiday Inn Express Condado. It was a very efficient hotel and was probably the cleanest small hotel I have ever stayed in. The rooms were immaculate and the maids were always cleaning. Computers were available for emailing home and there was almost never a wait. Swimming pool was small but nice. The only negative is that they have almost no parking room. This, however, seems to be typical all over Puerto Rico. Our room was plenty large enough and had ceramic tile floors.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsMWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: Mr & Mrs M Warwickshire UK We stayed in the hotel for one night pre-cruise and it was ideally located close enough to the airport after a long flight from the uk but also close enough to the cruise terminal not to have to spend too much time in a taxi. The local area is great lots of bars and resturants and a beautiful beach within walking distance. I would advise you to book a queensize twin room if you like space. The staff were friendly and the buffet breakfast was well worth getting out of the comfortable bed for. The pool was a good size and nicely enclosed for hotel guests only. If I was to cruise from San Juan again I would definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Well Run Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: nomar5955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while we were in San Juan. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The location is great just off Ashford Avenue, the main Street in Condado. The staff were friendly and accommodating in every way. The breakfast room served the typical Holiday Inn Express type breakfast. There is a pool and a Jacuzzi just off the breakfast room. There is sufficient shade for those of us who do not like to burn. It can be quite windy in the pool area at times. There is free internet just off the lobby. We enjoyed our stay and had no complaints and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ken2633
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Saturday night prior to a cruise and the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. As the cruise didn't depart until Sunday evening they allowed us to store our bags there while we explored Old San Juan. There was a nice beach less than a block away however we walked to El Morro fortress at the far end of Old San Juan and caught a cab back (about a 3 mile walk and definitely worth it). Old San Juan is mostly closed on Sundays so we will return in the future and spend more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!! Recommend for Budgeted people”
Reviews.Author: Cassie4486
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a pre-cruise for 2 days. It's a nice little hotel if you are on a budget & don't want to spend $$$ on the bigger ones. We had a corner room that faced the lagoon. It wasn't big, but fine for what we needed. The pool is small, its just behind the little eating area for continental breakfast. There was some construction going on while we were there. Don't know what they were building, but it was noisy. It' didn't bother me! I grew up in NYC! Home of noise! Staff is very, very efficient & very helpful. They helped me book a cave/arrecibo trip through them. We were picked up at the hotel for this excursion. See my photo's. I recommend this hotel. I think we paid like $70 per night or something. It's also within walking distance of several restaurants, ice cream places & fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: JMfromSJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday Inn Express San Juan PR for 2 nights 8/1 & 8/2 before going to Dominica. We booked two rooms-. One for Us(mom & dad) and adjoining room for kids. Both rooms had 2 full sized beds. Bathroom is not that small as some people reported. Rooms and hotel were clean and well maintained. AC worked great. Hotel is about 15 minute taxi ride from airport.-$22 for family of 6. Hotel is on side street about a half block from main Blvd. There are several hotels in area shut down for remodeling- Lots of construction.There is a nice swimming beach about a 5 minute walk. Pool was smallish, but nice. Hot tub fits 8 adults-nice. There were 2 computers for use. Breakfast was average - 4 cereals, hard boiled eggs, breads and bagels, fruit, oatmeal, coffee, tea, milk and juices. Old San Juan is about a 10 minute bus ride. Don't forget Quarters-$.75 exact change each way or $15 taxi ride. There are at least a dozen places to eat within a couple blocks and a Walgreens about 3 blocks away. We saw police walking the streets and the area felt safe to walk at night. Avis car rental is across the street, which we used for sightseeing and returned to airport saving a taxi fee. If we where staying longer we would have wanted a nicer hotel on the beach, but for a short stay it fitted our needs and price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: tonyfromdbx
Reviews.Content: For the past two years we visited the Hotel which by the way has a great and friendly staff, but the resources are scarse. They only have one computer available for the Hotel guest and its been that way since we went there the first time. Machines so old that their internet room looks like a museum. The pool furniture has a lot to say for the condition of the Hotel...Nonetheless I will go there again since its so well located and the price is just right...The staff makes up for the management lack of resources.

Reviews.Title: “Double Dipping into your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a complete and total rat(people)infested hotel. First let me begin by saying that this hotel was prepaid a month in advance. I alerted the clerk upon arrival she acknowledged that, the next day i was billed. after having told them it was already paid for. they had to reverse the charges while my card was still on hold. next,upon checkout again they were billing me the third time, my account was frozen for insufficente funds they bled my account dry. It was fourth of july weekend and the banks were closed. of course no one had an explanation. It took me to have to fax my bank the holiday inn express had to fax my bank call my bank long distance and have all this rectified before i left the san juan it was a matter of hours before my flight took off. This hotel is a rip-off scam game full of pranksters and quite frankly its a racket--and they claim to do business the american way--we americans don't cheat people. Don't stay here and if you do make sure you check each day to make sure they didn't triple dip into your wallet. Holiday Inn Express in San Juan should be called Taken-In in San Juan

Reviews.Title: “first time!!!”
Reviews.Author: JJAY74
Reviews.Content: I have just completed spending 9 days at the HI Express, the place was very clean the hotel was well located. near the beach and atractions in the condado area, parking is 10$ per day should be free but you can park in the streets, only you may have some problems looking for parking specially on weekends pool area very good, they close the pool too early 11pm . needs frigs in the rooms and breakfast should be extended until 10:30 am

Reviews.Title: “Rooms tired”
Reviews.Author: luischable
Reviews.Content: Maybe we just had a really bad experience but booked based on other peoples reviews. Arrived at 1am, no parking nearby so stopped outside to unload our luggage and was shouted at by the Security and told to move on. When I finally had found parking which on a Friday night is tough the guy in reservations was short to the point of rude. We got up early the next morning and found that there was no shower mechanism. Literally nothing- just a screw where it should be. We reported it to the Front Desk who sent a repairman up who was able to repair this and seemed unsurprised. On checking around the room we also noticed a socket with wiring showing and a large mud mark on the end of one of the beds. Not sure who had cleaned the room but definitely not up to HI Express standards. The location must be its saving grace. Not far from the Beach but would definitely recommend the Hampton Inn over this hotel. For a few dollars more you get a much nicer hotel with excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, no frills. You get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I come to Tripadvisor everytime I'm looking to book a hotel. I've read all these fantastic reviews for this hotel, so I thought I was getting a steal on my hotel rate. Though, when I got there, I was a little dissapointed and thought, well this is I guess what you pay for. They say the location is perfect, but with all the surrounding construction, my vision must have been skued. Don't get me wrong, Cartier is right around the corner, and so is Mont Blanc, and Louis Vuitton but also grafitti also within eye's view. And there were many places to eat (mainly chains) within walking distance. There are no frills; no grand lobby,opulant decor, but it is a budget hotel so that's clearly what it was. The rooms were descent sized and yes, at the end of the hall (on our 5th floor) we did have a view of the ocean. The bathroom is tiny, be prepared to back onto the toilet and turn your legs slightly and you're practically in the shower or right next to the sink. The free continental breakfast was a plus, Not many places offer that. They served cereals, bagels, toast, and oatmeal. The coffee, let's say, well it's free. The front desk was very helpful and very nice. I will agree with the other reviewers. The beach 1/2 a block away wasn't too pretty. It was surrounded by grafitti, so we walked an extra 5 min. onto Marriott's, where we used their beach chairs and towels. We did rent a car for the other half of the trip outside San Juan, and that was literally 1-2 blocks away. I think that was one of the best features for the location of the hotel. There are a lot of hotels in the Condado area, and it was a good value for it's money. But if the beach is one of your top priorities, don't expect much from the Holiday Inn Express. For the extra money, we would have stayed at the Holiday Inn in Isla Verde b/c it was alittle higher grade in accomodations and the location was more central. It will also limit the taxi ride fare, which could be applied towards a better hotel instead. But if you're truly looking to keep it cheap and just serve it's purpose, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Pirce And Location Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Carr3203
Reviews.Content: I have just completed spending a week at the Express. I must say the place was well maintained, the staff great as I had some basic problems and they addressed the situation right away. My room was clean and neat and each day I was there the room was cleaned and the bed changed. The conential breakfast was enought and if you were one who wanted to eat more it was always there as scheduled. The computer room with three cpu's was good and it did not cost extra as I found out in the Marriott. The location great only a couple minutes to the beach and the fine dining places. While there is some construction of other condo's taking place near the Express. It was not a big problem and I did not noise much during the day and none at night. The pool is OK not large not much sun gets to it but OK. Now the hot tub beside the pool was nice and could be used at anytime. The Gym OK for one who needs to keep there exercise program but most often I would join the others jogging by the beach area. Yes the bathrooms are small but since I was only about 154lbs, it was OK. Now for one alot more then that it may be an issue. The location as stated is great. The bus system to OSJ runs every 30minutes + or - , and only cost 75 cents. OO FYI-- the last bus out of OSJ is 9pm. Well hope this helps. I know when I go back again to PR I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: vacationlady1
Reviews.Content: I booked the Holiday Inn Express from the 800#. They confirmed the price including taxes and provided me with a confirmation number. When checking out make sure you check your bill. They tried to charge the $5 surcharge Iâ€™ve read about on this board. I would not agree to it since I had a confirmation number for the exact amount they quoted. At first the guy tried to tell me it was a tax and I disputed and giving him my breakdown (which was on the bill) and advised him I was not paying for a surcharge since it was not on my confirmation. They removed the $5 from the bill. So stand firm and dispute this charge. We caught a taxi from the airport to the hotel. $14 plus first 3 pieces of luggage are .50 each the remainder are $1 each. Our total was $15.50 since we only had 3 pieces of luggage. This hotel is in a good location for the money. If you don't mind walking there are all types of restaurants nearby. We picked up soda and bottled water for the week from Walgreenâ€™s. Princess allows you to carry it on with no problems. You can also purchase and carry on liquor. Old San Juan is an easy 3 mile walk, or take the bus (must have exact change (coins .75 one way, B21) Once you are in Old San Juan ride the free trolley to get familiar with the area. There are two routes the trolley follows. Shared a taxi to the ship with another couple to the pier was $22. They overcharged but did not realize this until we were at the pier since the taxis were striking that morning and we had a difficult time getting there. After the cruise we stored our luggage on the corner from the cruise ship. Large luggage was $3, small carryon was $1. When we went back for our luggage someone got us a taxi. There was another couple with their child going back to the airport at the same time and we wanted to share the taxi. We agreed to $5 each. After agreeing on the price they slipped another couple in the taxi with us and charged everyone (7 of us) $5 each. We were way overcharged for this ride to the airport. Also the guy who got us the taxi wanted a tip from each of us. Save yourself the hassle and GET YOUR OWN TAXI and eliminate the middleman who did nothing but arrange a ride to the airport. Taxis are everywhere since they are constantly dropping people off at the pier and the luggage drop off is right across the street from the ship.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April 2006, within walking distance of lots of things, talk to front desk about your parking options as there are a few, parking is very tight as you would expect in San Juan, limited paid and free on street parking, front desk staff good, rooms good, free breakfast good, try the hard boiled eggs, would stay there again, most hotels in area are much more expensive, short walk to Marriott Casino, some construction in area looks kind of dark at night around construction sites.

Reviews.Title: “A typical HI Express”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Folks, this hotel is a great deal. It is a two star hotel in a very good location, at the heart of tourist area. This hotel is clean, quiet, and convenient. Do not expect to be pampered - you get a breakfast, a clean room, and a cheap rate (I paid $100/night for a king bed on the 7th floor). There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The beach is 100 yards from the hotel. The luxury hotels and their fancy restaurants are all walking distance. The bus stop is twenty yards away. You will not need to rent a car for everything is in walking distance or close by cab/bus. If you want to be comfortable, stay in a clean room, but not taken to the cleaners, this is the hotel for you. This is a no-nonsense no-frill place.

Reviews.Title: “nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel Oct 13-17, 2005. I was on a long weekend get-a-way and wanted a semi-inexpensive hotel. I traveled with a friend and we had two rooms next to each other. The rate was around $80 per night, which was great. The hotel is nice and clean. It's not the Westin or Hyatt, but it's certainly a nice clean hotel with very friendly staff. I travel a lot and found this hotel to be good for the price. I've stayed at other hotels in San Juan for a much higher rate, and the Holiday Inn Express was much better. The breakfast is free and includes basic things. There is coffee 24 hrs per day for free. The rooms are somewhat small, but if you are planning on staying in the room the entire time you are in the Caribbean, you probably need some counseling! The only thing about the rooms that I could even find to complain about is the floor is cold... there's no carpet, just tile. The a/c worked just fine in my room... other's complained that it was warm. That might be the side of the building that they were on. I assume the afternoon sun would make the room hotter. After reading reviews of other similar-priced hotels, I was ready for bugs in my room, which is common in a tropical environment. There were no bugs to be found!! The pool area is quite small and somewhat boxed in with the high rises around it. And yes, one of the buildings is under construction. The hot tub was fun in the evening after a day of sight-seeing. And speaking of sight-seeing, the city busses only cost 25 cents. The B21 bus takes you right to the heart of Old San Juan! If you need a car for a day or two, there is an Avis right across the street. Taxi from the airport is less than $15.00. Overall, I'd definitely return to this hotel. The Condado area has a lot of construction going on which might create an inconvenience while walking. But, once this construction is complete, the area is going to be very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshine74
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly staff and very clean environment. Although they are doing construction in the area, we were not bothered by noise or anything. We would've liked to open a window, but for the HI express, it was definitely ok. The beach is right across the street and it is beautiful. It was the perfect location for shopping and food. Whether you wanted to visit the local dining spots or just hit a juice bar, you weren't far away. They also had many tour groups in the area offering snorkling trip, horse backriding and even a rain forest tour. And you never needed a car since everthing was in walking distance. All in all, it was the best HI express I've ever stayed in.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express San Juan
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Mariano Ramirez Bages | Condado, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
